CN_FtCcJxPdO5U8B9fT0GQ.text: I'm used to awesome restaurants in Portland like Ox or Toro Bravo, so I had low expectations for a small restaurant in Old Scottsdale when visiting friends in Phoenix. We ordered about half the items on the menu and every single dish was fantastic. Favorites amongst our group were the crispy broccoli, the carrots, the tomatoes, the pasta with duck, and the desserts. The service was superb though the bar did not quite match my standards. The atmosphere was inviting though not luxurious. Overall, an excellent dining experience with great value.

PTB2hFvOjdhkzL4UN_rImA.text: It really pains me to write this review because the service at FnB is always top notch. The friendly crew is on top of everything without being overly intrusive, they're kind and they have plenty of knowledge regarding their menu and wine list. They go above and beyond to create a great atmosphere.  My problem last night was the food. Holy cow was it bad! Each vegetable dish came out swimming in piles of oil. At one point I looked to my wife and said something to the effect of, "Wow... there's so much oil on this plate, my fork is literally sliding out of my hand." We shared six vegetarian dishes, each more oily than the dish prior. The meal got progressively worse. Sunchokes drowned in oil, leaks drowned in oil, you get the picture.  We've been to FnB before and usually enjoy the food. This trip was a disaster though and I don't think we'll be heading back. In the words of Tom Colicchio on Top Chef, "Did you even try the food before sending it out of the kitchen?" would be my question to the chef. Overall, great service, and that's the only reason for the second star, a very poor dining experience this time around.

gcqcq6q5lIzjwM_w5qTtDA.text: I took my boyfriend here for his birthday and was so glad I did. By far the best service we've ever had at a restaurant!! We were greeted with complementary champagne for his birthday and ordered appetizers right off the bat. Not even a minute went by after we'd finished the apps, a busser came by to reset and decrumb the table for our entrees. The bread basket was never empty and neither were our drinks. The staff is to die for and the atmosphere makes you feel like you're in another city! After our entrees (I got the seasonal pasta and he got the lamb), our table was immediately reset for dessert-butterscotch pudding-yummmm. All in all it was an unforgettable experience. Oh, I forgot to mention that all of their food is locally grown. ALL of it!

_YXoMP_SK0ohk-WYSDW0yw.text: FnB is a wonderful treat: vegetables prepared beautifully and uniquely, impeccable service, and a general sense of wellness that accompanies a meal that doesn't miss a beat. Pavle treats everyone as if they're family and walked us through a tour of the lagos, skirt steak, roasted potatoes, and so much more.  The lagos was a wonderful turkish-inspired bread dish served with enormous orbs of roasted elephant garlic, which we spread "like butter", served with a nice cream sauce. It was fantastic.  The skirt steak was perfectly prepared and served over an interesting cold salsa of roasted corn and apricot and some other goodies, with a chimichurri sauce on top. Spot on, and an interesting blend of textures and flavors.  And the potatoes. I did not know you could do such things to potatoes. Roasted and charred perfectly, with a nearly spongy crunch to them, served with delicious melted cheese and an egg on top.  The menu rotates pretty frequently so I won't go into too much detail of the several other dishes we had but I'll say they were all pitch-perfect, up to the amazing butterscotch pudding we had for dessert.  This is one of those special meals that will warm you over as you get to try new approaches to interesting ingredients. Each step is exciting and different and tastes fantastic. I'm not a wine drinker, so I can't comment on the Arizona-only wine selection, but I've heard good things and with everything else being so spot-on, I'd be surprised if it were to be found a shortcoming.  I plan on coming back in the next quarter when the menu shifts up again, but that's only because I'm trying my hardest not to come back immediately and do it all again.

6y4TXXPmvHAz1Z0ARyZiww.text: Visiting friends in the Phoenix area and were looking for a good lunch spot.  All I can say is that I wish we had more time to go back to FnB for dinner, as the lunch was divine.  The shaved fennel shrimp salad and the cauliflower caper ricotta dish were AMAZING!  Our server (lovely young lady) was very sweet to bring DH some toasted bread which we used to sop up ever last drop of the dishes.  Cute, cozy location in Old Town Scottsdale, which led us to roam around after lunch and have fabulous coffee down the street at Cartel.

pSlYCWPfCxr6wC_nocrQHA.text: People often comment that various Social Media outlets are a waste of time, brain power and lead to a loss of workplace productivity. For me, sites like Twitter and Facebook are a way to connect with like minded people and stay up to date on news and current events. For the Dwivedi family, Social media turned out to be a lifesaver.  Last night FnB Restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale hosted the "Tiny Fab Kidney Fund" late night dinner service to benefit Amy Donohue & The Dwivedi family.  Before getting to the food, a little background on the event. A decade ago, Anu Dwivedi was diagnosed with chronic kidney disease. Six months ago, her kidney function down to twenty percent, she was told the transplant waiting list was up to six years long. (not a prospect that brought comfort to her family).  Anu's foodie daughter Kirti decided to put her social media obsession to use via Facebook with a page she created titled "Kidney disease and my tiny mother," to learn and share her family's experience. Amy Donohue saw the page and decided she could help. She contacted Kirti, got the required tests done and the rest as they say, is history (or will be in the coming weeks when the transplant surgery is done).  In addition to the inspired cuisine FnB is becoming famous for, Chef Charlene Badman whipped up a few Indian inspired dishes in honor of the Dwivedi's. (half of all revenue from food & beverage from 10PM on + 100 percent of the proceeds of a silent auction totaling approximately $1300 went to the Tiny Fab Kidney Fund).  On to the nights food! My appetizer consisted of lightly battered, perfectly fried rock shrimp ($13) served with a well balanced jalapeno tartar sauce (with a hint of Meyer lemon and fresh herbs).  Alongside my rock shrimp was a heaping serving of three varieties of cauliflower , tossed with spanish peanuts, marinated in fish sauce and mint whose soft insides were perfectly complemented by their deep fried crunch. (this dish is simply delicious!)  Next up were a pair of Samosas ($5) filled with creamy sweet potato and accompanied by a small bit of sweet, tangy dipping sauce who's components slip my mind (Blogger/foodie foul).  Grilled spicy broccoli ($8) with pistachio and Meyer lemon aioli is flat out the best thing to ever happen to that humble green vegetable (its because of this dish that I know when broccoli season is).  A piping hot serving of traditional Punjabi Butter chicken (Makhan Wala Murgh) served over Basmati rice rounded out my meal. (I imagine this type of curry to be comfort food in Punjab).  If I had one complaint about the butter chicken it's that I feel the sauce to rice ratio could have been better. The rich, creamy sauce definitely would have benefitted from more rice in my opinion but the flavors were great.  So then, social media is informative, recreational and the bane of workplace performance but you never know, someday it could very well save your life or that of someone you love.  Side note: If you have ever wondered what it's like to experience True hospitality, make a reservation at FnB. Co-owner and front of house manager Pavle Milic is a study in graciousness, sincerity, service and will make you feel as welcome as anywhere you've ever been.

WnauFyPo12WTnxR0eiBz1A.text: TEN stars! Id eat here every day for every meal if I could. I enjoy everything Ive ever eaten here. Many fond memories here. I reccommend trying one of each. It is the only way to go. Get a few cocktails, a few apps, share an entre, and then dessert. Mmmmmm... then come back for lunch and dinner the next day to hopefully try anything you didnt get the chance to try the previous day. I look forward to any occassion to come here to FnB. Hey, look, its friday! Need to celebrate and go to FnB tonight! Yessssssss!

l0GrsQ4sbyVei331C7kTkQ.text: Nice and cozy and old looking setting. Great place for a friendly gathering or taking a foody date. really like the small outside setting, if you can secure one. I loved the wine and menu presentation. Good and interesting beer selection and very friendly staff.  The menu is full of complex and complicated dishes but try anything and you are in for a surprise. Most dishes are on the heavy side so feel free to share.

WMxocmYA-DLmMBhHYX8XLQ.text: When I think of gastropubs, a number of visions come to mind. For example, I think of creative, tasty food. I also think of a good selection of beer and spirits (that's the "pub" part. I also think about a lightness - space, light and comfort.   Unfortunately, this place offered none of these qualities. We were seated in a room near the kitchen that was cramped as it was hot.   The kitchen hood wasn't keeping up with the smoke from grilling, so the room had a cloud of smoke that floated just below the ceiling that reminded me of how bars looked 20 years ago when they were filled with cigarettes.   Forget about getting beer on tap (remember - 'pub!). Only a handful of bottled beers graced an inventive wine list, but alas, that was flawed too - our top choices were sold out.   Did I mention that the temperature in the restaurant was 78 degrees? It was like sitting in your grandmother's living room.   The food kept up the losing trend. The falafel was overcooked. We had a decent app of dumplings of a sort. The pasta with cauliflower was dense and lifeless - maybe it would have been better on a cold windy night, but not so much in the smokey, overheated gastro-sauna.   We were very disappointed.

YnnaFynekb2aNPVtFBuDbw.text: Finally snagged a reservation at FnB. Laughing smugly all the way to culinary frenzy starstruckedness. Hands up... best restaurant in Scottsdale if you're looking for something like French Laundry. Had a totally vegetarian dinner without even meaning to... I mean, the tender persimmons, meaty lobster mushrooms, firm in squishy okras and fiery shishitos had me quivering. I struck gold. And surprise wine concept: all-Arizona wine list. #Cochise etc, And met another blogger there who's on IG: themoderntraveler

6QyPb4l8ly_9YVtUEc5F4w.text: FnB was one of the best meals we've had this year. We had reservations for dinner on a Thursday night. Our server was absolutely lovely and patient as we asked a ton of questions about ingredients. We ended up having the Hot and Cold Pasta with zucchini, the Socca with roasted peppers, the roasted carrots, and the hog fish entree. For dessert, we shared the infamous butterscotch pudding. From start to finish, it was awesome. My husband and I couldn't decide which was our favorite dish. Flavorful and surprising...absolutely delightful. Cannot wait to make a return trip next time we're in Scottsdale.

JEYlUsV4LWuen9s9AbwANA.text: First. A bit hard to find signage not great where to enter.  Not just us another couple did the same thing.    Second.   Small menu.  5 items.  That is it.  Third.  Food was really good, creative and nice combination.      Would have stayed and ordered more but menu just too limiting

irvIBBW_vrP1-2FDZ2nLkA.text: Great service. Food was fresh and flavorful. Good selection of vegetables and the lamb was wonderful.

oVrk-qD9-xBDrdGw9GZC8A.text: Maybe my expectations were too high...  We tried 3 appetizers, 1 entree and 2 sides.  They were all creative and interesting but there was too much going on and I did not appreciate the local produces or any ingredients. The food tends to be a bit greasy/rich for my taste. We also tried the red AZ wines by the glass. I appreciate any restaurants that support the local wines but one of them tasted like kosher wine. I did not understand $11 or $12 price point for that quality. The service however was very good.

8Jww5NLrzSCBfDxll2-ipg.text: In Scottsdale for a conference, it appears that the Phoenix-Scottsdale area is (I am repeatedly told) *not* a place for fine dining.  But we found a small, local, and highly recommended restaurant that -- if we're ever back in Arizona (politics notwithstanding) -- we're definitely returning to!  FnB is a small place tucked inside a little courtyard of shops off 5th St.  With an frequently changing menu composed of an assortment of about 10 appetizers, 5-6 sides and only 4-6 entrees, the menu may be small, but never felt limited.  Focused on locally sourced food wherever possible, the food was excellent -- far more "exciting" and "intriguing" (and with much better service; the waitstaff here is excellent!) than the far more expensive meal we had the night before.  The wine list has about 25-30 different wines from local Arizona producers, as well as wines from elsewhere, but we stuck with the wines from Arizona (OK, one from Washington).  We started off with a Dos Cabezas white blend, "Meskoli," that was light, crisp, fragrant and very nice.  We then shifted north to Washington State for one of my favorite wines, the DeLille Chaleur Estate White, a Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon blend that never fails to satisfy.  The Dos Cabezas Aguileon, a Tempranillo blend, was truly excellent - a wine I'd buy here in Berkeley, if I could find it.    FnB is one of those neighborhood gems that you just treasure and try to keep to yourself . . . and your best friends.  If I lived here, I'd be here every week!  WONDERFUL!

NL2vqBEB-ubLzYXGCK98jg.text: This place is quirky and perfect and 5 stars deliciousness. The lamb manti was divine. The combo of cilantro and mint gave it a fresh kick. We also enjoyed the pickled shrimp with fennel dish. My only complaint but it wont affect "stardom" is that the wines were way overpriced. Be sure to make a reservation and enjoy the culinary ride.

5lkqNiX800d39gI-zXfGqQ.text: Fancy, delicious. Would recommend for a nice night out in Scottsdale. It's close to other bars and restaurants as well.

nHvUW66VgEY5YSbcxKF3Jg.text: I just have no idea what all the hype is about. Did I catch them on an off night?! I have been to highly rated and award winning restaurants around the world, and small local dives to Michelin Starred Gems....this was one of the worst meals I have ever had...all around.  I researched places to eat in the area before making a reservation for this one. In addition, it was recommended to us by a woman who worked at one of the nearby wine tasting rooms.   First off, the atmosphere was awful. The decor is simple and nothing to write home about. Fine...I saw photos online. But if the 2 rooms they have (which I only noticed on the way out or we would have asked to move), they chose to seat us and another couple in the same room a large rambunctious group of 15+ which sat inches away. The noise echoed horribly and we could barely hear each other. Finally, we ended up moving outdoors despite the heat to finish our dinner.   The food courses were ALL underwhelming. I was shocked. We had some kind of chickpea fritter sort of dish which was cold and soggy/chewy and another with watermelon. The watermelon was the shining star of the meal next to the bottle of wine our server, who had no idea what he was talking about in terms of wine, recommended. How do you hire servers at a place known for their wine selection that know nothing about wine?  While looking back to their website, I realize the James Beard Nom was for their wine, not food...which I'd originally thought. I suppose stop by for a glass but stick to ANY of the other restaurants around to eat. Will. Never. Return.

u4iz0H-Tf7fru-1k7AhZpw.text: Horrible service, weird menu items and very overpriced.  Would definitely never return.

1q2-2hp50j3YvAhG8ykcBA.text: What a fantastic evening I had at FnB. This restaurant had been on my list for a while due to acclaimed chef Charleen Badman. Starting with the ease of making a reservation online, to the wonderful ambience when we first walked in, FnB delivered on all aspects of our dining  experience.  The waitstaff is kind and helpful, often working together to service our table. They were clearly knowledgeable of the menu, which helped as my party was comprised of lacto-ovo vegetarians. Most of the menu, in fact, was vegetarian so it was difficult for us to make our decisions! The staff also mentioned which items were vegan, or could be made vegan.  Since the menu is seasonal, I won't dwell upon the food other than to mention that it was all superb. Each dish was delectable, from familiar dishes like falafel to new ones like apple sharlotka. Together, my boyfriend and I enjoyed four vegetable dishes and two desserts and spent about $85 with tip (and a coffee with dessert!).   I would certainly go back to FnB again to experience some of the best dining in Old Town Scottsdale.

Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

41nr5nIBbQNs5LdeoVbNtQ.text: The service and food were both fantastic. We especially loved the Peruvian spring rolls, leeks, and collard greens. We did wish that there were more entree-style dishes to choose from (we ended up getting only starters because none of the entrees appealed to us), but the menu changes frequently so that could have just been the day we went. Overall very happy with the experience and would return!

AIoKLdgnjzYJLxETxZMJ0A.text: Wonderful restaurant! The food is creative and very tasty. The goulash is made with short ribs and incredibly tender. Don't miss the desserts! The butterscotch pudding is incredible, and the black bottom pie had a lemon filling - I didn't think the flavors would be compatible, but they were great. Very attentive service. The only problem we had was finding it - it's in a little courtyard off of 5th. We will definitely go back!

laYN1M_GZ1dpeP_r7yNTlQ.text: We have eaten at most of the three-star Michelin restaurants in the US.  And most are great in our view. We are as happy eating at FnB, where the food is creative and delicious, and where the service and ambience is as good and often better than those restaurants. This is because of Chef Badman and Pavel and their entire team!

1OeFkQ5wR-CH9ZTZA_efAg.text: Great bartenders, super attentive and friendly. They went above and beyond to ensure we had the best experience possible. The rest of the staff was extremely frustrating to deal with. We arrived at 7:30. They are supposed to close at 9, but claimed the kitchen was closing at 8 tonight, due to maintenance. We were told we could sit at the bar and have full service, although we were given the impression that we would be rushed. We left at 8:30 and noticed 2 large tables of people who had clearly just sat down and hadn't even ordered food yet, a whole 30 minutes after the kitchen "closed." Upon asking the hostess, she claimed that the groups had a reservation and the kitchen was closing after the parties placed their orders.

N9sQo36FD80Ya2hyK5IBdg.text: My boyfriend took me here for our anniversary dinner so expectations were high. Luckily it took us by surprise! The service was great and our server was really knowledgable about both the wine and the food. We were indecisive about what to pick off the menu so we asked our server to basically order dishes for us. He picked things that complimented well together and was just overall delicious (and probably were things we wouldn't have ordered ourselves). He also recommended a wine we ended up loving too.   The menu changes constantly but the dishes we ordered were:  - yuzu cured salmon, wheat noodles, ginger-sesame dressing, tea egg  - beets, melon, pumpernickel croutons, goat cheese, vadouvan - butternut, delicata squash, lime, goat cheese, cumin, mint - langos, liptauer, arugula, marcona almonds - pasta, green beans, schreiner's bacon, potato, pesto, parmesan  We decided to only order one of the main dishes since we weren't interested in getting a big piece of protein. Even the pasta itself, while quite good, wasn't the star. The vegetables actually stood out the most. So fresh and perfectly seasoned! Highly recommend sharing dishes and even going with around 4 people to try as many things as possible. Can't wait to go back!

QVnNxlXiHI7ENuSOvKIkMg.text: Creative and satisfying food as well as atmosphere. James Beard award winning chef along with partner specializing in AZ wines makes for a fabulous experience

SXRKdr36tdADnND05g_5OA.text: This was by far the best restaurant in Scottsdale I visited. Great service and comfortable setting. Except for a couple of random figs that I could not figure out why they were on my plate the food was thoughtful and spot on.

agpOrF-9k2ttj-heanv6kg.text: My headline for FnB is trying too hard! Came from out of town for a girl's weekend, celebrating milestone birthdays. We selected FnB based on that they are equally known for showcasing the bounty of Arizona's local terroir with an award-winning wine program according to their website. When in Rome sort of thinking: AZ food and AZ wine while in AZ = sounds great.  Our table of five was crammed with a chair on the end, in the traffic flow, our server didn't know anything about what would be considered the good AZ local terrior plates and wines to share as a group, as promised on their website. Told him we liked CA Cabs and were looking to try AZ wines. He suggested a Grenache that was sooooooo sweet - nothing similar to what we told him we liked at all. So disappointing for a place that "was nominated in 2017 by the James Beard Foundation for Outstanding Wine Program".  Maybe they need better training, higher quality of servers or just send a Sommelier over for wine suggestions. Maybe the James Bread nomination is based on whats in the cellar, not the server knowledge and expertise. Food just seemed to be trying too hard to be "the epicenter of creative Arizona cuisine". Nothing stood out as OMG delicious or AZ special.  Something should of been OMG out of all the plates we tried.  I mentioned in my OpenTable reservation that it was a special out of town birthday outing. No dessert offering or mention of it at all by our server to see if we wanted something special, which in the end was just fine as we couldn't wait to leave and continue the celebration else where. So disappointing over all.

uXZKDTJ272vKRlwdDBrjHQ.text: Every single time we come here we are delighted- take their recommendations on any dish and you won't be dissapointed .

i9oZQX9UzWXmuduXdS-8LA.text: Sauces are incredible. Example, the Grouper was awesome. Falafel appetizer was delicious. Service was excellent.

Hot24OZ4__VXPvAbkfzpXw.text: Omg this food is so rich in flavor I cannot wait to go back. Service was incredible, people were so kind and helpful. Small and quaint - very charming in the heart of Scottsdale. Try everything on the menu -AMAZING art with flavors of food - compliments to the chef

IF60Vmby54M-TbNRsCwwnA.text: FnB was our favorite meal during our visit to Scottsdale. Everyone here was incredibly friendly and our server was great! The food was comforting with unexpected but much appreciated surprises.   We started with the summer squash and pickled corn. I have never had pickled corn much less with what I believe to be crushed corn nuts. It was amazing. A little sweet, a little salty, and just a kick of spicy and sour with a corn nut crunch. It kind of reminded me of an amped up chile picante corn nut mix.  For entrees we had the famous fried chicken and  pasta with bacon and fresh pulled mozzarella. Both were great but I loved the cornbread that came with the fried chicken. It tasted like orange zest mixed into some creamy whipped butter.  Great spot and a must try!

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pickled corn
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Summer squash and sausage
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kitchen view

4kBiwL4ODIpWnWVw2_tn-w.text: Impromptu meal and they squeezed us in. The place was warm and cozy, the staff was delightful, and the food was great. We would definitely recommend FnB! Thanks guys!

FJLXVLOI9HfLftrfGduDYQ.text: Great innovative lunch. Had a carmelized grilled butternut squash sandwich with arugula, bacon slices, and burrata. The waitress kindly substituted goat cheese for burrata. An excellent amount of crunch paired with the sweet and salty squash and bacon was perfection. The bread could have been grilled a bit more. The $12 Bloody Mary was on the small side and lacked flavor. Stick to the $5 southern French rose. Definitely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sandwich

XZmCt4ajbmGSKcBqZu_ApQ.text: This place creates good imaginative food. However our server, a heavily tattooed charming fellow, did not serve us well. The limited but spectacular menu is organized into three sections. There is a wonderful appetizer, salad, small plates section, a shareable vegetable section, and an entree section with only four choices. All spectacular.    I asked my our server if would be appropriate to share one of each course between my very petite wife and myself?  We were two couples sharing a nice table. He highly recommended that we each order an entree and a starter and split only a vegetable per couple. We each shared an appetizer (fabulous chicken spring rolls), shared a vegetable (one couple ordered the cauliflower and the other Brussel sprouts - both great), then we each ordered our own entree. Two chickens, goulash, and swordfish were ordered and enjoyed immensely.   However neither couple could finish more than a third of the vegetables ordered and more then half of the sizable entrees were boxed up.   The food is good enough that we will enjoy our reheated lunches, but when I go to a new (to me) upscale restaurant I would prefer to try more smaller portions and less massive servings. This server didn't understand my goal or was too focused on increasing the check size to care. Perhaps we put him off when we ordered wine by the glass!  It was a Wednesday so not polishing off several bottles of wine seemed reasonable. The fact that he disappeared as soon as the food began coming out and I had to ask a busboy to retrieve our bill makes me think he was just padding our check.   We will never come back and we eat out 3-5 nights a week in the Phoenix area.   The restaurant takes its food seriously. They should focus a little more on the total dining experience. Frankly, I would have preferred to order half a dozen starters, one vegetable, and one or two entrees for the four of us.

Li8PnQjYiI8M94tijrZuAA.text: I am so glad I made reservations to have dinner here on a Thursday night because it sooooo much easier to find parking than on the weekend when everybody is partying.  Now on to the review of the restaurant: My first impression was very good until I decided to sit at the bar. Now, maybe I was expecting too much but the barkeep did not appear to be as welcoming as the hostess/server. In fact, she did not set a glass of water in front of me until I finally looked her straight in the eye. Maybe I'm mistaken but from what I've been told bartenders are usually more talkative. Unfortunately, the bartender tonight was more interested in chatting with her buddies than making conversation with me. There was no attempt made to converse.  I really wish I had not given up my table. If I do decide to treat myself again at FnB i think I will dine at a table instead. At least at a table I will have plenty of room to spread out and read my book or magazine.  The vittles for this season's menu were very good but nothing to write home about. The current menu offerings are posted online so I think if I do decide to go back I will check the menu first and see if anything catches my eye. But, I will not make a special drive out there like I did this evening. I really wish I had just took a 3 minute drive to one of the local restaurants near me instead of making a 30 minute trek and being disappointed.  The food is solid but not out of this world and service was mediocre at best for my experience. I might try this place again but not anytime soon.
