Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Current menu

Yh63t3u68gkYebMXW6r49A.text: I can't help but feel I'm in a snobby...  entitled ...not happily serving...type of venue. The ingredients are excellent...carefully picked and prepared. Many of the dishes are over complicated and from the few times I've been there...always have an under taste.. that is the same.  I respect the intent of the owners..and I respect their culinary abilities but I think the restaurant is cold feeling and over rated.  Sorry ..I'll pass

9H1tlsm1S5gFeqzfi7hA_w.text: What a great place, good food, the service staff is on point and the quality of food is very very good.  007 Martini (Vespor) was a throw back that makes crack seem like wack...delicious.

9Bx_bfAB2AGzZXVCVChpuw.text: This place is definitely worth multiple visits, and we will be back.  They clearly are obtaining the best/highest quality/freshest meats and vegetables and doing amazing things with them at reasonable prices.  The chicken is prepared flawlessly and creatively.  The spicy broccoli is excellent (and actually spicy), although the aioli is a bit heavy-handed.  The turnips were a bit underdone/bitter but still tasty nonetheless.  Would love a larger beer and cocktail list.  Service is excellent between a variety of attendants.  Sit at the bar/chef's counter if you can.  Food is the star of the show.  The panna cotta dessert with blueberries is a can't miss.  The reason for the 4 star instead of 5 star review is based on the condition of the restaurant and the bathroom.  Unfortunately, the 4'x2' ceiling tiles are not only ugly, but dirty as well.  More importantly, the air vents, a couple of which are directly over the piles of various food ingredients and prep-area on the chef's counter, are black with dirt/grime/dust.  The thought of that air blowing directly on our food was unappetizing to say the least.  This place needs an entire new ceiling.  The porcelain cats on the counter should be done away with as well.  Also, for a place this big, they have just one solo bathroom, for the clients & staff.  It's kind of run down as well.  Just could/should be done a lot better.  The vibe is great here, both in terms of employees and diners.  Several locals were remembered by the staff, but everyone feels like a local after a few minutes.  We will be back.

Hg-gFCyl8orDaQkfO-xp8w.text: Hands down one of the best meals I have ever had my in entire life.   Seriously.   This place is off the hook.  We started with a fresh mozzarella with diced olives, cilantro and green grapes, and a carrot vegetable patty(crab cake style) that I could honestly eat at every meal.   Then I had a salmon that was so fresh and delicious I didn't want it to stop, our waiter, who was amazing,  had literally fished it himself.   Desserts were incredible, rich butterscotch pudding and a strawberry sweet cornbread with ice cream, like a strawberry shortcake.  If you are around Scottsdale, it's a must.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

XQf-_o459J-SotM9SKU-Fg.text: FnB is a bit of a hidden treasure with amazing food and excellent service. I recommend trying as many different dishes as possible, as the ever-changing menu features a lot of unique options.

CzjMmUu7jiO34vYyrOQ13Q.text: Phenomenal meal. When we arrived we were promptly greeted and seated. Although the wine by the glass choices were limited, there were decent options that matched the menu. The service looked a little backed up, and our first drink took quite a bit longer than expected, which brings the fifth star down.   My date and I started with the lamb manti, which was incredible. It was a dish of little pastries filled with lamb, served with pomegranate and middle eastern yogurt and cheese. It was a dish I had never eaten before and is something I'm excited to try again, the best dish of the night.   We also had the pasta, spaghetti squash and lamb chops, all of which were excellent. I doubt there is a bad dish on the menu. Definitely go if you have a chance, this is definitely one of the best spots in the valley.

QoaR-8kNR-G6jBfAlPWpaA.text: We just love this place so hard. Never disappointed. Yes I'm biased but I'm not the only one expressing this sentiment, please try it if you haven't yet. Thanks Pavle

TyBkZWfPqT8XOcP3FS8WFw.text: The food is delicious, farm to fork yadda yadda, but they put way too much sauce on every dish. How do you manage to make organic vegetables an unhealthy meal?! This was especially the case with the brussel sprouts, which were absolutely drenched in sauce and it took away from it's natural wonderful flavor. Chefs, as good as the good is, go easy on the prep. The famers already did most of the work for you.

MUsNLqgS2a650JfCvAiIfg.text: I didn't get it? The food was alright I guess... The waiter was super nice, but the restaurant is teeny tiny, and... I dunno... lacking? Way over-praised.

GnNcS-fGMD8QEKcRwss5YQ.text: FnB is one of the best restaurants in Arizona. I have been consistently impressed with their delectable dishes comprised of fresh local ingredients. Pavle and Charleen are certainly an amazing team and it's clear that each of them is passionate about what they do. Pavle's hospitality and knowledge shine as he takes you through the menu and makes sure you're comfortable and well taken care of throughout the evening. Charleen is a master in the kitchen and turns out the most amazing plates. Veggies never tasted so good!  The atmosphere is intimate yet fun. From the moment you enter FnB you're treated as a friend. I've been a happy customer since it's near beginnings, and I've always had a perfect experience when dining there.  As far as menu specifics? Get the butterscotch pudding! Even if you weren't expecting to get dessert you shouldn't pass it up. Also, most of the time, my husband and I go the small plate route (and maybe order an entree to split as well). We love how everything sounds--and we're pretty good about sharing--so we find that ordering small plates is the most exciting dining experience for us. If you're not so experienced with wine, don't worry! Pavle will help you. I told him I had no idea what I liked with wine and he responded, "Of course you know what you like! If you know what you like in food, you know what you like in wine." Again, the unshakably friendly demeanor you can expect at FnB, even if you're not an experienced oenophile.

YzxDWUXVk5xrTupGCi_SnQ.text: Fun time!  We ordered the skirt steak which came with roasted corn and peaches. The steak was delicious and it was cooked perfectly. The chimichurri really was a fabulous contribution to the steak which was already wonderful.   We also had the socca cakes and the shishito peppers which were amazing. We especially couldn't stop eating the peppers.   For dessert we had the sticky grapefruit cake and the peach ricotta tart. It was a wonderful ending to such an awesome experience. I also loved how the menu changes seasonally and how fresh everything was.

uaywyrwuuhXbroQgR2bYuQ.text: I have had the pleasure of dining here on more than one occasion, every time I'm in Scottsdale, we find an elaborate excuse to come here... Oh, it's my birthday next month, or Oh we all haven't seen each other.  If you haven't been here - brace yourself for a great meal - always something new to try on the menu - the owners are AMAZING, and will even pour your wine into your mouth from their 3 foot long decanter (not on the menu)  Go here immediately!

p9n-l94_9ZHQnlArL6hgag.text: my wife texts me on friday "i hear they have the famous leek dish at FnB. can we go". i reply "sure". so she made reservations for that night and we got in at 8pm.   first i have to mention there were alot of people out and about. i love to see that in old town. second, FnB is F-in smaller than i anticipated. it is local legend for the leeks and egg (available only 3 months out of the year). and i've read the chef has a soft spot for veggies.   we ordered of course the leeks dish and a brussel sprouts dish. was it good? yes. but i was expecting fireworks. i didn't really taste any of the leeks...only mounds of gooey, house made mozarella. which is not a complaint...i love homemade mozarella. but with regards to the entirety of the dish, i wasn't that impressed.   the brussel sprouts were good, but to me, tasted like i would have simply grilled them myself.   my favorite dish was the cooked to order falafal. it was warm, crunchy, and had the exact same texture and "runiness" that i long for in a perfect falafel. it put my 3 stars up to 4 strars. the radishes on the side were a pleasant accouterment.   my only one negative overall was our server, who was extremely passionate and vivacous, was mostly MIA during the meal. our food runners were pleasant and kept the water glasses filled though.   the maitre'd informed us if we come back to reserve a space at the bar/kitchen prep area. we'll have to try that next time.

xE5YL7QhoyLgH1r71Ypn0A.text: The reviews don't lie!* FnB is exceptional. The service is personal, knowledgeable and attentive in a way that I haven't experienced in a very long time. We started with the Food and Wine, top 10 dishes of the year, braised leeks with housemade mozzarella and an egg. It was good. But, I was just as happy with the fresh bread and (so good that it's) green, flavorful EVOO.  We had the Halibut, Broccoli and a special of prawns. The broccoli was something worth writing home about. I'm going to try to duplicate at home. As the girl next to me at the counter said, "it's the best broccoli you've ever had times 100." The Halibut was lovely. Cooked perfectly, lightly seasoned and served under a salad featuring kumquats from the chef's neighbor's garden. That's local!  One of the more interesting, engaging dining experiences that I've had in a long, long time. Reserve a seat at the FnB counter immediately, if you like fresh, inventive, local, in season food with impeccable presentation.   *Except for the Gastropub part, the food is too light, fresh and the setting more intimate than a gpub.

GjVrDzQWiIdHVuLoavGiVQ.text: When I knew that I was coming to Scottsdale to attend an event, I started looking up places that I should try and this one came with the best reviews. We called to make a reservation the evening that we were going, and they told us that they would call us back with a time. Sure enough, in five minutes we received a call that there was a spot open for that evening.    We were seat and greeting within a couple of minutes of arriving by Nathan. About 15 minutes into our dining experience there were a group of intoxicated girls that sat at the table next to us and were very loud.   There were 3 of us that were in our party and we ordered the lamb, fish, and pasta. We all shared the grilled broccoli. I enjoy the braised lamb with the rice. The broccoli has nice flavor to it and would recommend to anyone that eats here. For dessert, we had the chocolate cake which was a nice finish to a good meal. I would give the food 4 stars.  As we were brought our dessert, I asked the women that brought it out if there was some way that the girls that were still next could quiet down. They were loud and the service staff saw playing into them causing them to be louder. She went and told our server and he did nothing about. I never heard from from anyone in the restaurant. For this reason, I give them 0 stars on the service side of the meal.  I feel that this could have been a good meal if it wasn't for the drunk girls next to us.

4Tvbvd6gmfYYm2QIEqL_3Q.text: The restaurant was half full and so loud half our table couldn't hear the waitress. If we had stopped after the appetizers I would have said it was great. We had every entre on the menu they were all average at best. Chocolate desert was inedibly dry. Service was ridiculously slow. I don't understand all the love for this place. None of us will go back.

RbI3hX-Sr9SvojCN4RDyZQ.text: Just ate here for the first time last night for my birthday dinner and it was PHENOMINAL!! I don't think I've ever had a meal with so many different flavors in every single course, all of which were perfectly balanced and blended together.  And my wife isn't usually one to try a lot of unique dishes like the ones featured at FnB, so she was a bit hesitant to even go here, but she absolutely loved everything - and that's saying a lot!  We started off with the world-famous braised leeks, which were perfectly cooked (hard to do with leeks), and the combination of flavors with the egg and the mustard panko smothered in mozzarella (which they make themselves) was amazing.   Then for the main course I got the pasta and my wife got the halibut, and we split a side order of the rutabaga (sadly, they were out of the spicy broccoli).  The pasta  - WOW!! It has so much going on with the bacon, chanterelles, tarragon and a wonderful creme fraiche-based sauce, that I couldn't decide what I liked best about it.  And the halibut w/cauliflower and chermoula was out of this world, and my wife liked it so much that all I got was a few small bites.   And then we finished off the meal with two desserts.  The first was a few scoops of roasted banana ice cream sandwiched between two pizzeles with rum raisins and chocolate fudge. It was very good except for the fact that the ice cream was slightly bitter, which makes me think they either used bananas which weren't ripe enough or they didn't roast them long enough. But then again, I'm comparing it to my own roasted banana ice cream that I make which is out of this world, so I'm a tough critic when it comes to that. :) HINT: use 6-8 well-ripened bananas (showing just a few brown spots) chopped up and tossed with a mix of 3/4C brown sugar and 2T rum & 2T butter, roasted @ 325F for 25 mins, for every 2qt of ice cream.    The second dessert was a black walnut & pear cake with a side of creme fraiche whipped cream.  I don't think I've ever had black walnuts before, and the flavor is SO good and SO different than regular walnuts, and the subtle sweetness of the pears was a nice contrast.  I highly recommend it.  All in all it was one of the best dining experience that I have ever had, and I have eaten at  lot of very nice restaurants including Le Jules Verne (at the top of the Eiffel Tower) and French Laundry (in Napa). And the prices were very reasonable for being such a quaint restaurant with such eclectic cuisine.  If this restaurant were located in a place like NYC, Napa, Paris or even a high-end shopping plaza in Scottsdale, you would easily pay $200-$300+ for this type of meal, but here in this small side-street gem of a restaurant our total bill came out to a mere $98 (not including drinks, tax or tip). I can't wait to come back again and try some new things since the menu is constantly changing according to the season. I also hope to stop by for one of their "Late Night Love" events to try some of their unique one-off meals.

1YSoIlgWy74SQuJkNXuTNg.text: A trendy wine bar-restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale that celebrates local. Have never had a bad meal or experience at FnB.

QglkvOXSXK7xofenJ59pHg.text: Was walking around in downtown scottsdale and stumbled upon restaurant FnB. Was surprised to see the place was empty, but was quickly greeted by a young gentlemen named Maccalister. I asked to check out the menu and he convinced me to stay for lunch. I was the only patron so I received all the attention. Maccalister (Mac) versed me in FnB's support for local produce and local wine. The food was fantastic! The chef definitely knows what she is doing with Vegetables. I will recommend this restaurant to anyone of my friends and can't wait to check out their dinner. Two thumbs up.

mXTHAzK2OsCdpsQEMDwMNg.text: The menu changes everyday, which makes it tough when you find something you like! We had a liver and heart pate (Tasty, it reminded me of Liverwurst) For dinner I had the 1/2 Chicken (Great), it came with a spaetzle and mushroom side (Great!)

cd2jbaGEdcfS_z5b9qFu-Q.text: Ok, I'm updating my review yet again. i'm losing sleep over the fact that I gave my absolute favorite restaurant a 4 star review due to one off night. My husband and I love coming here, and we love bringing friends here to try the awesome food.  Some noteworthy highlights since the last review:  --We attended the vegetarian night here in January. Of course I loved every bite, but what was really cool to me was that the restaurant was completely sold out that evening. That says a lot about Charleen's way with vegetables. Absolute magic!  --We finally got over our fear of AZ wine and tried a bottle of the Dos Cabezas El Campo, included in the  SF Chronicle's top 100 wines of 2012. The Dos Cabezas Syrah that went with veg dinner was great too.  --FnB has moved to Baratin's old digs. I miss sitting at the counter but love the bigger space. Hopefully we'll make it to the Frank Sinatra table one day.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best chilaquiles I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Example of a vegetarian plate- roasted turnips, grilled asparagus and stewed tomatoes and greens. Lots of awesome food for $18
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Korean fried chicken

LYo0TjMNE0FwQD4c-n02Rg.text: Ok.  WOW!  Vegan review. Spaghetti Squash was out of control! Then main cous cous dish good. Menu changes so doesn't matter what it is. Vegan friendly and no skimpy portions. The wait staff "under sold" me. How cool is that. This group did a nice job training staff and getting it right.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fav!!!!  Spaghetti squash. Never came close to this way out of control taste and presentation. I am ready to order another.
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cous Cous! Nice.

Fv9dg_msyEmLN3nt_wzaxQ.text: Dinner perfection! Menu was well thought out and plates had unique flavors. Service was exceptional. Meal was coursed out in a complementary way. We wanted to try everything so we did starters and sides. So delicious! Would highly recommend! Our favorites were the roasted tomatoes and the chocolate cake with huckleberry sauce. Epic!

Kiac8VpKyElE53M2OBWAXw.text: This is a nice, sort of pretentious lunch spot. Super limited lunch options, all healthy with well-chosen ingredients. Very much a place I might find at home in Berkeley, CA.   I had the salad--the only salad--which was pretty good. Wish I wasn't on a low-carb diet, the grilled bread smelled and looked good even though I couldn't enjoy it. And the $5 dollar lunch wine was a steal for the Riesling I had.   I'd check this spot out again.

d39e8xaGThxuHLYU_DUFww.text: We visited FnB again for the third time; it continues to be a favorite. The food and staff are outstanding.  For an appetizer we enjoyed the Lamb Manti, which is a combination of a dumpling and ravioli.  The lamb filling is seasoned with mint and cilantro garnished with pomegranate, yoghurt and pine nuts. The flavors are fantastic, we loved it!  The beet salad with horseradish vinaigrette had an amazing zing to the pallet, very different, and is the perfect salad course.  The pasta entree with sausage was perfectly cooked and had great flavors.  We talked about this dish the next day!  Really should not be missed.  So simple and so well executed.  The staff does an excellent job with food and wine description along with wine pairing by the glass.  100% of the wines by the glass are sourced from Arizona.  We do not live in Scottsdale however FnB has become our favorite restaurant when we are in town.

Y--YLbtOvIhMLk6bZFPHJg.text: If you are looking for a pleasant and refreshing dining experience in Scottsdale, go no further than FnB. It's classy with a diverse menu and an enjoyable patio. Tucked away on east 5th, you will find a wonderful respite from other busy restaurants.   It's connected to a market and offers an extensive wine selection and great dishes featuring seasonal produce. The wait staff is very helpful and personable and its evident that they value service.   After enjoying some complimentary fresh bread (delicious!), I dived into a bowlful of shishito peppers with crema and some grilled okra with hazelnuts. The okra was amazing! The hazelnuts added a touch of crunch and sweetness and the okra was perfectly charred. FnB certainly knows how to provide a great evening.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled okra
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious cocktail

i1xMC1mnqbhxNWapzYYmMg.text: I'm overwhelmed at the meal we had. We bought out the entire restaurant and the chefs went crazy.15 courses all wonderful. Still trying to decide what I liked the most. Tie between these little lamb dumpling things with yogurt and charred sweet potatoes with  sweet chili sauce. Everything was fresh and flavored just right. Food Heaven

FPTR8PQDgKTt_vsgZm4tIA.text: Went here for a bite to eat in between looking at apartments in the area. We had the "sampler platter" (had bacon, pickled Corn, egg salad, etc) it was super and they had a $5 wine special at lunch that was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7wLkomc6g-xevXbcASSLKw.text: This was a great local find.  I was in Scottsdale for the night and wanted to find something more intimate and more bistro like with healthy options and Yelp led me this direction.  They also open later and being on west coast time it just ended up I was always eating later than normal.  When I first walked into this place I noticed that there are two sections to sit, one is an area where there is a bar with other tables nearby, and then there is more of a dining room next to the bar.  Since it was late and causal I opted to go for the bar area.  It turned out great as the service was just as good and it had more interesting people on the bar side.  I won't go into details but lets just say there was a passionate couple sitting at the bar and it definitely provided entertainment value watching them make out for an hour straight. No eating no drinking just doing their MO.  Watching the waitress dance around them with serving was pretty funny.  Anyway that said the menu offers a lot of very innovative dishes many are vegetarian, a few are vegan.  They can also modify the menu pretty easily.  The dishes we had and I recommend them all highly is wild greens with pickled jalapenos, and a creamy rice underneath.  This dish was incredible with the mixture of vegetables, spices and creaminess you get with a risotto dish.  I almost didn't believe this was dairy free.  It was like major comfort food aka crack.  The other pasta dish they had on the menu was very simple with veggies but it again was so flavorful.  I also recommend the brussels sprouts with curry lime and the arugula salad was simple but great.  They have a nice wine list and local beers.  the service is very friendly and attentive even though it was pretty late at night.  Will definitely be back as I hear they change up the menu often.  Oh and the prices I thought for Cali standards was very reasonable.  Yes the dishes were mostly veggies but with all the layers of flavors they all had it was totally reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Veggie pasta
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wild greens and rice (aka crack)

eKtvYpLCZq8TTJGlF9Zp5w.text: Visiting from out of town with the family and came here on a whim. Ordered a couple items from each bracket and was absolutely delicious, honestly couldn't complain about anything. From making a reservation, to the servers everything was fabulous

ZnIzFQbl-EoP-PeG3C6JKQ.text: Need a serious attitude check  Just because you have a reputation for good food Does not give you the right to be rude and stupid to your customers  Not worth trying when the people here are so rude and unpleasant to deal with  Hope you get what you serve  Time will catch up to you

UL9D7_KWwvmeofMBMcLofQ.text: This is a really fabulous foodie find in Scottsdale.  It reminded me of the hyper-local cuisine in Seattle -- not your typical Phoenix restaurant for sure.    Everything is uber fresh, local, and flavorful.  We mostly tried specials and each one was delicious.  We had a fresh butter lettuce salad with radishes and jalapeno, Peruvian spring rolls, and duck empanadas.  The butterscotch pudding was to die for.  Even the wine list is hyper local (I didn't even know they had wines in Arizona). While the server was kind enough to let us try some of the local wines, we opted for a California blend instead.    Service was attentive, knowledgeable, and low key.  Ambience is a bit loud, very focused on the food and not much else.  But that's the way it should be at a place like this.  Would definitely return the next time in the area to make my way through more of the menu!

a9WvKZh5G-8NRob_JXw11A.text: Very nice small restaurant.  Has a couple private dinning areas for parties of 8-10.  We just had drinks on this occasion.  Drink menu limited but good.  As with many restaurants in area not many options if someone drinks light beer (actually no options).

hAraKlzVqaDBV-yeHk_gNw.text: Came here with only a party of (3) and were told that it was impossible to split the checks. Totally a lazy server move. We left, wish I had a chance to try the food but the service with an attitude 3 seconds in will def. "ding" your 4.5 yelp rating. Didn't expect the BS with so many good reviews.   Need to retrain employees on this or specify that you won't split checks as a policy. I work in the food industry, my family owned a restaurant in NYC for 20+ years, so I do understand the etiquette. I was polite about it as a courtesy to my server, and asked about it as SOON as we were seated. Server was being straight up lazy.   Literally 10 other places during my stay in Scottsdale accommodated the split checks for much larger parties.   Manager if you are reading this: a quick conversation to the servers on this would be appreciated. If you are a manager or owner who feels this is a picky BS review and it won't effect your business by not addressing w/staff: I'll look you up in 10 years and see who's renting your space at that point. These small things matter.  Any excuse about the plating system doesn't apply guys. We could have put a few of the plates on each of our checks if that was going to be your out for the bad service.

MvS-WLlX_qBjPsCcCkENfQ.text: Fantastic cocktails and very good small plates. We didn't have reservations but managed to get couple seats at the bar. Definitely would recommend getting reservations especially for the outdoor patio, it looked very cool.

l3gx8RkHj6bmD6iHjb_UcQ.text: Wonderful imaginative world cuisine. Chef and ingredient driven. I discovered this gem on line while on a short trip to Phoenix.  Had no idea where or how it would be.  The three of us were thrilled. Excellent cocktails.  Innovative apps. Fresh salads and solid mains.  A foodie oasis in a desert of bar food.  Heartily recommended.

PD_j1Cis_Gp6MRMPI8m3ig.text: Best food we've had in Scottsdale so far.  The appetizers and the main dishes were perfectly flavored.  It's a simple menu with an abundance of taste.  Service was impeccable as well.  Reservations recommended.  Even though they were busy, food came out pretty fast.  Would absolutely eat at this place again to try the rest of their menu

VvmQFzYFOTT4Xkillt6_rw.text: I took my work team to the restaurant for lunch today and was expecting a great experience especially with the high reviews on this site. We had a 1215 reservation for lunch for 7 people. The menu seems very simple. Only offered 1 option for anything. 1 salad, 1 veg, 1 sandwich, 1 pasta. After we were seated, it took another 10-15 minutes for us to get our order taken. Once the order was taken, this is where the waiting really begins. After 35 minutes, the food finally came out at 1:10pm. We were literally sitting there for almost an hour with no food in front of us. In fact, there was a couple outside playing cards waiting until their food to arrive. Clearly they have been there before and know the etiquette for waiting for lunch.   I was truly embarrassed as I picked the place with the understanding it had great food. Once the food finally came, it did look good and my team seem to like their food. But for a lunch time offering, we needed to get back to work and there is no way anyone has over an hour to eat lunch. Not sure i would ever return.

wURyVqG4XW3ZEa5UsEe-pA.text: The seasonal menu means there is always something new, fresh and delicious at FnB. We had a party of nine last night and our service was excellent. This is the ideal place to bring out-of-town guests because you can have absolute confidence in an ideal and unique experience. We are fortunate to have this gem right in the heart of Scottsdale.

M521AQeORmQwkzlkohCXLg.text: This place lives up to its laurels. Three of us had dinner on the patio on a warm March evening. All from out of town, drawn by their James Beard nominations, and we weren't disappointed. First off, Arizona wine?  The waiter steered us to a delicious bottle. All three appetizers were shared and delicious. Who the hell thought of combining fish sauce with harissa?  I guess a really good chef at this restaurant did, and it made the mussels amazing. Entrees of chicken, pork shoulder and carrot risotto were all great. Eat of us tasted the other's food and there was no loser in the ordering department.  A great evening with good food well prepared and good wine. P S: Dessert didn't suck! We would definitely come back here if in town again.

Djsfej76bUd39AqoqHNXMg.text: This place was outstanding! It wasn't overpriced either...a little pricier than average but well worth it! The staff was very friendly and attentive and the food was fabulous! The Lamb Manti was a perfectly balanced appetizer with a hint of sweetness and enough tartness to brighten your palate. The Pasta entree had an amazing sauce and delicious mozzarella. I'm not a zucchini fan and it was delicious in the pasta. Overall great restaurant and I would definitely recommend it.

3tXIz6ZdmKVca6nv50dRpQ.text: Hands down THE BEST restaurant I have ever eaten at in my life.  There food is always fresh and cooked perfectly.  They change their menu every couple of months and I try to go each time they change the menu.

hfK7yzaqIjN6rjuvMzCbBg.text: Charming spot! Love the atmosphere. Great service as well. Food was okay, nothing special but not bad. I guess I had high excpectations after reading all the amazing reviews. I also could not find wine I can drink. I am all about supporting AZ wines but not if they don't taste good...

jNq6xaeU6ZpdnOVN-AxBPw.text: FnB is firmly in my Top 3 favorite restaurants, and the only one of my 3 that is actually affordable to eat at more than once a year. I'll admit, my wife and I moved from the Phoenix area just before Pavle & Co jumped to their Baratin location, so I can't vouch for the vibe and atmosphere of the new place. I can however vouch for the fact that we only had 2 dishes that disappointed over approximately a dozen visits. Their championing of Arizonan wines is brave, and ultimately a brilliant move, given that there are now so many incredible wines coming out of that state. The most amazing thing at FnB however, is the dizzying array of vegetable dishes that Chef Charlene would create - the Leeks and Grilled Broccoli standing out immediately in my mind. Pavle is undoubtedly the most charming host you'll ever meet - if he ends up serving your table, you'll see what I mean. We miss this place so much... When we next are in the PHX area, we'll have another visit to FnB inked into our schedule.

I0bKBUBhd8PXiDId4lm8yw.text: Incredibly done food - very innovative, creative cuisine. Had lunch and dinner here on my last visit to Scottsdale. Real butterscotch for dessert, to die for! Service is also top-notch, the people here make you feel special, you can tell this restaurant is owned and operated by people who really care about their customers and love food. Only wished I lived in Scottsdale so my wife and I could dine here more often.

2n7nr1bPBTse0NQCYNqh5Q.text: This is a nice inviting place. The setting is charming and it's a perfect date spot. Although I came here with my buddies, we didn't mind this intimate place one bit. The Pork and Duck Pate is quite amazing. Last time I had a great pate like this was in Paris so I'm glad I found this place which I'll be returning very soon again.  Servers here know their wines. I'm not a wine connoisseur by any means and although we drank beer this evening, our server did a great job in wine pairing recommendations.  If you're into Seafood, try the Santa Barbara Mussels. The sauce is terrific.

Y1N1-Ev2Ik4iffnE3tBFKw.text: If I could only eat at one place for the rest of my life, it would have to be at FnB. This is ultimate comfort food for me - with the bulk of the menu highlighting local in-season organic vegetables from McClendon and other local farms. Charleen prepares dishes that pay the ultimate homage to the vegetable and the farmer with perfect seasoning, contrast, balance and temperatures.   Beyond vegetables, the housemade burrata was light as a cloud and shrimp grilled to perfection on the mesquite. Dishes at FnB are simple but often the simplest dishes are the hardest to get right as there is nothing to hide behind - ingredients have to be fresh and of the highest quality and execution must be perfect. Charleen and her crew strike it out of the park almost every time.  Service is professional, attentive and friendly. Pavle and his team make you feel right at home, which is the other reason why I would happily eat here everyday.

v075Bq4snwSY4kSCliFjDg.text: Had a wonderful meal and experience last night, love the small but very interesting menu, changes daily. Four of us shared lamb riblets, cheese, falafel then Dave's Chicken and ciopini   All favors fantastic, great service, nice ambience. We will be back

PZETDBeFlVnFviYruSv-JA.text: They say love hurts. I love FnB, and the place hurts me.  Trying it on the recommendation of many friends, we snuck into the counter on late notice to give it a try. We had to try the appetizers, right? Oh, and they were so good not a scrap survived.  Our main course - same problem.  Stuffed, whimpering, we saw them trot out the desserts. Oh no, no... but we had to try them, right?  Moaning, aching, we waddled out of FnB stuffed to the top with good F and B.  If our poor bellies survive, I hope they toughen up as we want to put them through the challenge again!

8aht1UyDJHVUihp6QArdcQ.text: I like it, I really like it!!!  I am a very simple eater, I like good food, and want it to be reasonably priced.  I do not like pretentious restaurants, which are "in" for a couple of months, and then change after the initial reviews. That said, when a good friend wanted to try FNB, I was good to go - but in my mind I was somewhat hesitant, wondering if it was one of those places that had a rush of good reviews, then service, ambiance and quality would slide.  I need not have worried.  I was impressed. After walking by the front  door,  Pavl was standing in the door and greeted us. I had never met him before, but he is one of those genuinely nice, warm human beings that love the world, and everyone in it. I did not have a reservation, but he immediately sat us and truly made us welcome.  It was like dining in some one's home - everyone made us feel at home, and actually seemed concerned about our evening and the meal.  I had the Alaskan Halibut and it was outstanding.  I also tried the Jadori chicken, and it too was wonderful (I had not ordered it - it was half a chicken, and I would have ended up with it in my lap). Of course,  I am a beer drinker, and their choices were limited, which I had expected - but they did have a beer brewed in Prescott, which was fine.  They are known for their wines, and they had an extensive wine list of different local wines available, which I understand are quite good.  It is rather expensive, but the atmosphere, food, and service make it reasonable.  And yes, even if you don't know him before you go in, Pavl will seem like an old friend by the time you leave.

HH5XraQQE9--32gPhxuOXA.text: Excellent lunch! Limited menu for lunch, but I find that refreshing. Everything fresh and local. I had a very good Arizona Stronghold white wine, Tyro?. Then a plate with apple sausage, crispy grilled bread, fennel apple salad with a tangy light dressing, and homemade applesauce. Wonderful mix of flavors, complementary yet different. Quick friendly service, and pleasant ambience.

hiLzJOCbgW5iSp77SdDMnQ.text: Went for a late Valentines Day dinner date.  Food was very good and the prices were what I expected for Old Town Scottsdale-high.  While there were plenty of wines to choose from the lack of a real beer selection was highly disappointing.  When are the high falutin chefs going to realize that many beers will pair better with their food their wine does.

vYG-hpdIA-KjLXGKf01fIA.text: Are you kidding me?  OMG.  I am not a frequent giver of the 5 stars.  Sooooo delicious.  By far, my favorite restaurant in Scottsdale.  For apps, a piece of cheese and the radishes with local honeycomb and butter...ridic.  I wouldn't shut up about it.  For entrees, chicken, salad, and pasta with duck confit.  Amazing.  For sides, brussel sprouts with bacon, broccoli, and rutabagas with ginger creme fraiche.  All interesting flavors with excellent preparation.  For dessert, chocolate cake with toffee, blood orange sticky cake, butterscotch pudding, ginger with some sort of quats.  Soooooo freaking good.  Friendly, attentive, and appropriate service.  Great atmosphere.  Lively and nice, without being too loud or too stiff.  I could go on and on.   We will be back!  This places lives up to all of its accolades.  LOVED IT!

MGxXOjuVO7aAv9jn9pPy0g.text: I had higher expectations for FnB based on reviews and word of mouth.  The food was hit and miss.  The lamb was prepared really well, but the stuff that went with it was a mess.  The pasta was mushy and had way too much limp bacon.  The leeks dish with egg was good but really wasn't an appetizer as listed.  The butterscotch pudding was probably the worst dessert I've ever had, gritty and chemical tasting.  You get the drift.  The service was also uneven. It was sort of like we'd shown up to a party uninvited or something.   I wouldn't go back.

b8Pz1iP8LasITh5rXUqPsw.text: So I was looking for a great place for dinner that wouldn't be packed or overwhelming but still had great food.  Enter FnB.  First of all, thank you to the amazing staff who were incredibly understanding when we came in 30 minutes late.  Who gets lost in Scottsdale?  Ummm...we do, apparently.  The atmosphere is cool, kind of old school diner-y but with a laid back sophistication.  I liked it.  Our server came by to offer us drinks and mentioned that his favorite red was from the vineyard of Maynard James Keenan.  Who knew?  Well, he does have a good voice so I decided to give it a go.  And it was pretty good.  I like how the chef is not afraid to offer non traditional dishes.  We decided to share a few, including the chopped chicken liver, smoked trout, crispy rock shrimp and jalapeno tartar, and asparagus, cauliflower puree and crispy beets.  Everything was simply prepared and delicious, like comfort food.  I like this place.  It's mellow but still cool and has great service.  I'll be back when I'm in the mood for something different.

EWvKGHWJw9EwnSSOvddqHw.text: Great food!!! Fresh, local, flavorful cutting edge menu. Love the look and the vibe. We both had the brisket which was moist and seasoned perfectly. A little pricey but well worth the experience.  Quality food, great atmosphere!  Long wait to get seated but well worth it!

nbHqEvZSDPmjwhPRRCTHUw.text: This is going to be a weird review for me.  I'm normally not a fan of places where I don't really love the food.  We were only there for appetizers then had to move on for the evening.  Everything we had was pretty good but it is more "chick" food than anything else.  I have no doubt everything was made to order using only the highest quality local ingredients, but I found it a little too fru fru.  Same with the entrees with the exception of the pork chop.  I love the look of this place and I love how helpful and friendly the staff was especially the owner (at least I think he was the owner or something).  I also love the idea behind this place - a place that specializes in quality Arizona foods AND wines.  And the final clincher as to why I am a fan of this place (and probably most importantly) is because my wife loves it.  She wants to come back soon and try every single one of their appetizers and sample some other AZ wines.

4AjWj5oRYGsAJUsR2OraLw.text: My wife and I ate here on Thursday after the Art Walk. Everyone was very friendly and knowledgeable.  The pickled shrimp appetizer sounded really strange, but it tasted delicious.  The menu features a number of local wines that we found surprising good.  FYI - They do run out of dishes here. We originally ordered a special appetizer but it was sold out. We also saw them run out of two other dishes.

BQhxN5C2WHKbVH9g8S2nXQ.text: Another great local restaurant.   This place is pricey (at least for my budget) but if you're looking to treat yourself I can't think of a better way.  It's a smaller place, I like being able to see into the kitchen, but I feel like they need a little more space. It can be too cramped for groups larger than 4 - and even 4 can be a stretch.   But the food is incredible. It's locally grown and it's so hard to pick when you're looking at the menu. The only solution is multiple trips.  And if that's not enough, the service is phenomenal. Our waiter (and also owner I believe) was extremely helpful. He described the menu items to us in mouthwatering detail. And when I asked him to pair a glass of wine to my dinner, he took the time to really consider it and ask me about my tastes and found a wine that I absolutely loved. So much in fact that after the rough day I'd had, I asked him to bring me another glass. I joked "I don't know how much it costs but it was so good I don't care. No, don't tell me, I don't want to know - I just know after the long day I had I deserve another glass." He laughed at that and then a few minutes later he came around and topped my glass off, instead of charging me for a full second glass. I really appreciate little things like that. That one move pretty much solidified me being a long-term customer.  Try FnB. You won't be disappointed.

d2cqrKtwfdKw6hEZ17UeOg.text: Fried squash blossoms stuffed with cheese and dipped in a tangy, vinegary marinara. An enormous rib-eye with a spicy chimichurri served over a bed of tomatoes and rice. A light, refreshing lemon panna cotta with tart strawberries. Mouth watering yet?   I had dinner last night with a friend at FNB in Scottsdale. And unlike some other uber popular restaurants - you can believe the hype. The service was wonderful, the food was rich and complex, and the whole experience was satisfying.   A few comments -   It was really warm in there. I'm sure it's tough to keep such a small place cool with the kitchen in the middle of the room. I was fine with the temperature through most of the meal but by the end I was ready to go.   Drinks - we were offered water to start and were given a rundown of the "mocktails" they had available. (FNB is byob). But we were never offered anything else - it left my dinner companion and I wondering - do they serve other beverages - tea, coffee, soda? There was nothing on the menu.   Overall a great place and definitely worth a second visit!

-rMei8_SfgbFOllv749FVQ.text: Viva FnB!!!!!!!!!  Just Phenomenal....truly one of the best dining experiences my wife and I have enjoyed anywhere.  The  Service, Seasaonal Food, Ambiance, and Wine list are just superb.

yL80UXxRnRFVdLoE7NtRBw.text: FnB is an excellent restaurant, and more so because of the owner and staff's attitude and intent to provide a very intimate dinner.  My date and I arrived late after a very busy day of trapeze training, and were graciously seated at the bar, and treated to a very enjoyable conversation about the food, desired taste, origin of the ingredients, and the owners background.  The chef made the most spendid meal, in front of us, and then stopped every so often to ask about or talk about the meal.  Great place, give it one of my highest recommendations.  Go for the food, go for the mood, whatever, just go.

AJAyw7j_ozCeCWzw9Y3fOw.text: Add me to the list of those who call this their favorite Scottsdale restaurant. Just that. The menu is a delightful excursion, the wine list is superb and the service cannot be topped.

kXSjHOfHj3mDJdhH4fgaCA.text: Great atmosphere.  Not pretencious.  Clean, homey and hip. Best of all- DELICIOUS.  This place is run by some major girl power.  I loved the watermelon, feta, cucumber salad.  Wow who knew that all went together.  I had the chicken they have this summer and it was just so flavorful.  The dessert is good, but not over the top (but some times I LOVE over the top).  Such a lovely dinner.  I will say I don't think it's for kids.

Av1Rl-edhyfSu1YNh6f10A.text: My girlfriend and I dined for the first time Sunday night at 8pm. When we walked threw the front door and entered the tiny dining space I immediately noticed something that set them apart from the restaurants located on the same block, and that was every seat filled with happy people on a Sunday night.  As the night went on I found the food and the wine to be great, but the best part of the evening (besides my girlfriend of course) was the personal touch the owners give to there guests. It's not any one thing, but the fact that they are hands on (which in my opinion works best in this business) is what made the night for me. To see the chef/owner throwing down behind the line and at the same time answering guest's questions on methods and ingredients and also owner/hostess/waitress/manager she is really something, seating people ,answering the phone, taking orders, and managing the awesome staff and still having time to chat with us. I have been in this business for 16 years and have never been apart of something as special as FnB.  Make a reservation, try the Pillsbury Diva and Enjoy!!!!!!!!!

SJ6z2qZBZ7rSblQIEDI6Hw.text: FnB you've got my full attention! Okay foodies, I'm sure you've read about FnB in the past months or so. In the place of where Digestif used to be, hails a new victor in culinary truth. In a quaint yet sophisticated space featuring a remarkably glossy multicolored artlike tile floor, FnB features a menu that changes sometimes daily with the freshest produce, all from local Arizona farmers. They also use other fresh ingredient from local vendors. The freshness certainly shows in the taste and integrity of their food, it is so delicious! I had been looking to come here ever since I saw a picture on facebookof their braised leeks/mozzarella/mustard breadcrumbs and fried egg phenomenon! People, this is food porn worthy in my books. One glimpse of that dish and I simply knew I was destined to dine there. So, with a drooling comment on my friend Jay's picture status, I begged him to PLEASE call me the next time you want to go to FnB!! Happily for me, that day came about a week later :) Upon arrival we took a seat at the bar. You could call this a bar, but I call it a food voyeur's naughty pleasure. You see, the whole kitchen is surrounded by the bar, so if you choose to sit there you'll get to watch Charleen Badman work her magic while enjoying a nice glass of Arizona wine. We were warmly greated by Pavle Milic, the restaurant's owner and also our server for the evening. We both got the "Vino del Barrio Blanca" ($10.0/glass) from Pages Springs Vineyards right here in AZ. We then ordered up two appetizers to share and relaxed with friendly conversation. Of course, we ordered the braised leeks/mozz/breadcrumb/fried egg ($13.0). We also tried their duck/pork pate which was a new addition to their changing menu. Both were amazing, but I must pay close attention to the best salty and savory thing I ever ate in my life! Yes, I just said "best...thing I ever ate," because it is True. That leek dish changed me forever, as I now crave it in my sleep, it was that amazing! I watched as Charleen put the fresh mozzarella over the leeks and stuck it under the broiler. Then, she prepared the out of the broiler, slid the egg on top and dusted with the mustard breadcrumbs. over easy egg in a small saucepan over an even smaller double burner, giving it a generous sprinkle of salt on top. When the cheese was perfectly melted over the leeks, she pulled it I really could dedicate my whole article on this one plate, as it was for me, perfection. The perfectly cooked greens, the melted stringy cheese, breadcrumbs, and maybe my favorite part...the crispy around the edges, over easy egg! It had a salty, savory, creamy, slightly chewy, and warm flavor in every bite. I'm pretty sure they saw me scraping the plate to get the crusted mozzarella off! Oh my god, it was just unbelievable. When you go to FnB, you'd be a fool not to order this delight. Next was the duck/pork pate. It came on the plate with two pieces of crispy bread, a few softly roasted cippolini onions, some pickled cauliflower and cucumber and a dollop coarse ground mustard. This pate was very nicely put together with the perfect amount of fat content and seasoning. The pate also had pistachios in it that gave a nice texture contrast. It really tasted like my dad's liverwurst that he's been making for years from an old world German recipe. For me to be able to compare it to something homemade and authentic from my dad's market, makes it top notch in my book! The onions were great, as you could smear them onto the hard crusty bread and accompany with a piece of pate. I loved the bi-colored pickled cauliflower, it was delicious For the entree it was a hard decision as all of the four entrees on the menu looked amazing. We went with sharing the flat iron steak with cauliflower, caper, and golden raisin salsa verde ($21.0) I totally didn't realize until we got our entree that Pavle didn't ask us how we wanted our meat cooked and I'm very glad that he didn't. This steak was cooked to an absolute perfection. Nice sear on the outside with a juicy red medium doneness on the inside. It had a very clear, pure beefy flavor and just melded so nicely with the caper raisin salsa. You'll notice we had cauliflower twice that evening, but that was not a problem at all as it was so different each time we got it. In the pate dish it was cold and pickled. In our entree we were given a beautiful purple cauliflower that was roasted with what tasted to me like some fresh grated parmesan, but I cannot be positive of this. Either way, I really enjoyed the distinct flavors of the cauliflower each time, it was really great. When we thought we could feast no more we told Pavle we'd be skipping dessert. However, Pavle simply wouldn't let us leave without something homemade and sweet in our stomachs. Such a kind man to make sure my sweet tooth is paid attention to ;) ...read full review on ErinForney.com

nDatMRTEmXEehni6vnwi9Q.text: We went last night and loved the place! FnB took over the old Sea Saw space next to Cowboy Ciao in old town Scottsdale. You will love Pavle and staff. They are the kindest people. We tried the meat and cheese plate and crispy rock shrimp with jalapeno tartar and loved them. The cheese plate comes out with the best tasting fresh baked bread. The shrimp is very crisp and flavorful with the jalapeno dip. I don't even like jalapenos, but love this dip!   We only stayed for drinks and apps. The rest of the menu looked excellent. I had to look up what gastropub meant and it truly describes the menu. It is like gourmet comfort foods. The place is a small cozy place with a bar area where you can sit and watch the chefs cook your meal. I felt like we were in a little bistro in New York. It's like being in a intimate restaurant and watching the chefs (like the food network).  We watched the chefs prepare several of the entrees and they smelled and looked really good. I saw the roast chicken dish, braised lamb and the boneless trout go buy and wanted to grab the plates out of the staff's hands. I think all the Foodies will love this place.  We will go back again and I'm going to go for the entrees!

JG0h7UFi5C2yzaYEvzxfXQ.text: We noticed this place when we were on the way into and out of Cowboy Ciao next door the day before (see zero star review), so we checked out the Yelps and figured we'd give it a go.  Like night and day; this place was the polar opposite of its neighbor.  The service was terrific and the food very good.  They seem to change their menu regularly, so by the time you visit, they may have none of the dishes that we had.  For starters, we had the meatball dish and the braised leeks.  Both were delicious and I thought the meatballs were phenomenal.  For the entree I had the bucatini and my best girl had chicken.  Again, both dishes were delicious, and the portion size of the chicken was more than my wife could finish, so we left with an extra meal in hand.  The staff people were very helpful and friendly, and all told, we had a really nice meal.  Next time we're in the area, we'll make a return visit.

nQ8s2m_876TfqgoWENZThw.text: My wife and I came here before heading out for dinner reservations.  We had a great appetizer plate with cheeses, grilled bread, preserved fruit, and other really good things.  We also had some local (Arizona and New Mexico) wines that were quite good.  The service, however, was the best--  Everyone was very attentive, but not too obtrusive, and very friendly.  I'll go back for dinner when in town again.

EYQ-8PC6xxaLPeaNBRSSmw.text: Solid 5 stars for an overall great experience.  This is my favorite kind of spot -- with excellent food and service, but without any of the pretentiousness that is often found at top restaurants.    The food was inventive and excellent.  The braised leaks lived up to the high marks given by others.  Our lamb entree was also a highlight.    The service was super.  Joshua was friendly and engaging.  We took all his recommendations on ordering and was very happy with his choices.  If you plan to have wine, I recommend skipping the main wine list that is exclusively Arizona wines and asking for the "Plan B" list with other (better) options.

0xP49KZ4AoX0IMDUXK-eJw.text: My husband made a reservation at 7:15p for our anniversary, we were promptly seated. We had requested the counter, how fun, watching 3 people cook about 2 feet away! We ordered the pickled egg, leeks with egg, mmmm, spicy broccoli, yes SPICY and pasta, say no more! Delicious! Yes, it's abit small, but the atmosphere was buzzing with laughter and clanking wine glasses! Chantel, you're the best! What a great way to end our night!

BrlCmCYcoEZVwHhtOHf7OQ.text: Loved this place!  We went there last night and it was fantastic!  Similar to other reviewers, we experienced very friendly and personable staff who knew their menu, wines, and beers very well.  Menu items we loved: the spicy broccoli with crispy onions and the leek/cheese/fried egg dish.  We also ordered the smoked trout salad and the fried green tomatoes which were also delicious!  The chef uses very creative techniques and ingredients to make this a fantastic dining experience!  Highly recommended!

77hO-O-Z_gFp-caVTEA7KQ.text: Fried Squash blossoms!  How do they come up with this stuff?  FnB gets 5 stars for creativity and service... oh, and the food is pretty amazing too!   The menu changes with the season, so I apologize in advance for making your mouth water by mentioning  food you'll probably never taste.   We started off with the appetizer special, Fried Squash blossoms stuffed with burrata served with fresh tomato sauce, and an order of naan with eggplant puree.  The Naan plate was nothing special, but the blossoms were fantastic.  For dinner Hottie had the lab chops with couscous and I had the pasta with butternut squash and pesto.   The pasta was amazing, I watched the chef make my pesto to order... mmmm basil!  Hottie devoured every bite, so I would say he enjoyed his chops too.  For desert we shared the panna cotta with cherries, it was the perfect ending to a great meal.  This place gets 5 starts all the way, from the moment we walked in, the service was impeccable and the food was superb.  Thank you FnB

m_zXTbyMvGDI-2AJcFZpeQ.text: One of my favorite restaurants of all time.  I live in Albuquerque and get to Phoenix a few times per year and always have FnB as a place to go.  It's a casual and cozy atmosphere with great service and amazing food.  My favorite dish last visit was the Cauliflower, yes Cauliflower... it was sauted and had a Thai like sauce, wow!

tRtpIcDBQHPvztM48jEcPA.text: We sat at the same counter space as our last (and only) See Saw experience.  The ambience, food, beverages, and service were all top notch.  Best plate of food was the braised leeks and fried eggs.  Also had some overlap with the post 10pm menu and they smelled amazing -  will have to come back for that.  Awesome people working there - it really makes the restaurant.  Hopefully they will keep on going strong despite the economy - all locals support our restaurants especially when summer slowdown hits!

IO3xb9aPdu_WuPpdyoc54g.text: One of our favorite restaurants in the Phoenix area. The chef is originally from new York and you can see her cooking live in the open half kitchen as you walk in. Small venue with exceptional service and the menu changes as items go in and out of season locally. Extremely knowledgable staff that can cater to foodies and novices alike. If your in the mood for wine check out their selection of Arizona wines. Stronghold is a go to for the wine list. The broccoli is not to be missed.

97Vm3hujwwkdEUzOZpKQNA.text: Friendly service and a really creative menu. Everything was delicious. Went in for an appetizer and ate that, an entree, and dessert. Eggplant and tomato salad was unique and my favorite item of the night.  Fun twist was all Arizona wines, which were very good.  This place was just GREAT, start to finish. I am still stuffed...

OVJh9ar8IFuYk7GBzDmX2g.text: What a wonderful dining experience! From the moment we walked in we were treated like special guests by the owner. Best yet, the food totally lived up to the impeccable service, culminating in a perfect evening. Even the all AZ wine list - which caused me concern - measured up to the exceptional high quality of the food. We wil be back  - this place is a foodie's dream!

5cojyIo-qyTfpK2D0OEVIg.text: We had been looking forward to trying FnB for awhile. We thought it was good - great fresh ingredients and definitely different than other restaurants. However, it just did not "wow" us. We ordered the radish, butter appetizer which was good - freshly churned butter, and I ordered the pasta special and the husband ordered the jidori chicken. Both were good but not incredible. The desserts were very good - panna cotta with candied kumquats, and a chocolate bread pudding. The service however was exceptional. Perhaps, we will try again when the menu changes.

v1-PY-G4cKCxEPM7lReqKA.text: This is a surprising find in downtown Scottsdale.  Extremely sophisticated food, interesting takes on vegetables, small plates to share.  Really hip, relaxed environment.

86BGhtzJtoxasc5ZkFf__w.text: I can't believe it took me so long to get here.  Really small, hidden, but super cute restaurant.  Seemed as though most customers were regulars, which says something.  A lot of veggie options and only a few entrees.  Our apps were good, nothing too remarkable, but the Bass and the chicken dishes were outstanding!! My son said the chicken was his favorite meal this year (and we eat out A LOT!). Just great flavor combinations in a cute little cafe with a very friendly staff!! No wonder it's always booked up!!  I will make reservations and definitely be back many times!

-qDFtXZPCHVbu5U4gkLnzQ.text: Great place with a fun non pretentious vibe. Every dish is made with exacting detail. I was truly blessed to share an evening with a some friends. I was fortunate enough to be invited by Ty who is regular customer and well knowledge of this menu. He took me to this extraordinary place with some other friends. We sampled and shared many appetizers; falafel, salt cod, mushroom dumplings. Main dish was lamb and we had several other side dishes. Every thing was exceptional and so well prepared. There's a clear and deliberately intense flavor profile with every thing we sampled. Thank you FnB for a well executed menu, great service and delightful libations.

B-MHR4LZCXK5Hwx6E5Z9Ew.text: This is a True gem!! The only negative thing I can say about FnB is that we didn't find it sooner. Lol!! The food, the setting, the service is all amazing. The combinations of spices and flavors are wonderful. The food is beautifully presented, like works of art.  They focus on using local produce and everything is incredibly fresh. Great cozy comfortable place for a date night or night out with friends with great food and conversation. They offer many vegetarian options as well. Definitely make a reservation because they do fill up quickly and have a limited number of tables. Wish more restaurants were like this. So happy we found it!!

v8B-Uv1930oH4tM3nN9zHQ.text: Charleen Badman is often cited as the best female chef in Arizona.  She's been nominated 5 consecutive years (including this year) as Southwest Chef of the Year by the James Beard Foundation.  To add to her numerous accolades, Charleen & her FnB team won top prize at the 2018 Devour Culinary Classic (the super bowl of AZ culinary festivals).  FnB had been on my radar for awhile, but their recent triumph at Devour made a visit here all the more urgent.  As I write this today, its International Women's Day.  What better day to grab a meal from supposedly the best female chef in the state.  Arriving at 5pm, I was mostly clueless about this place, but intrigued.  FnB is somewhat hidden in Old Town Scottsdale, so I'll make getting there simple for you.  Goto Citizen Public House, then walk one block directly east and you'll be right on top of it.  FnB is essentially four different spaces in one.  In the front entry is a small bar area, followed by the main bar, followed by the main dining room that overlooks the kitchen.  And of course the outside patio if you prefer that option.  Altogether I'm thinking seating for about 100 or so.  As I was here on my own this go around, I opted for the small bar area.  From 3pm-5pm they actually have the small bar open for light bites & drinks, but the main event doesn't start until 5pm (thus why I waited).  Charleen co-owns the business with Pavle Milic.  Charleen runs the kitchen while Pavle is mixing & mingling with the customers whilst educating them on FnB's extensive wine offerings (quite literally hundreds of different bottles of wines to choose from).  Most of their wine is sold by the bottle, but they do have a limited number of wines offered by the glass.  I'm a red guy & their 2013 Oliver Winery Syrah Blend sounded right up my alley.  A smooth medium bodied wine that was so good I got two glasses of it.  I also got a free bread & olive oil snack to start (the bread is made by the valley's very own Noble Bread Company).  Charleen's reputation as a world class chef is largely earned by her ability to extract the absolute maximum flavor from the fruits & vegetables she sources from Arizona farmers.  In fact it's earned her the nickname Veggie Badman (which also just happens to be her Instagram moniker, but I digress).  The menu here changes seasonally, but always has a heavy tilt towards fruits & veggies moreso than the meat dishes.  As such, I asked the bartender for recommendations on perennial & popular items.  The first item she recommended was their Oranges dish.  Orange slices, honey, bee pollen, basil, pistachios, & yuzu kosho (a type of Japanese chili seasoning).  The presentation is a gorgeous kaleidoscope of color on a plate and is phenomenally delicious.  The honey elements do a great deal to mellow the tartness of the fruit & give it a more savory flavor.  For my second dish, I got their Peruvian Chicken Spring Rolls.  The chicken is cooked with an assortment of herbs & mixed with pecans, then wrapped in a fried egg roll atop a bed of aji amarillo pepper aioli.  Fantastic.  The aioli was spicy but manageable & mixed wonderfully with the chicken and the rolls cut easily with a spoon.  Wanting to save room for dessert but still hungry for one more plate, I opted for what the two bartenders both told me was their favorite item on the menu.  The Cauliflower.  Heirloom cauliflowers topped with brown butter & mustard seed sitting atop a bed of almonds & fresh made ricotta cheese.  Wow, wow, wow.  The cauliflowers themselves were perfectly cooked with just the right amount of char, but the brown butter & ricotta elevated this in a way I never expected.  Truly a dish where Charleen's veggie whisperer reputation is well deserved.  To finish, the bartender offered me a dessert menu, but almost immediately said there's only one dessert item worth considering.  FnB's most popular dessert dish is apparently their Butterscotch Pudding with whipped cream & nutmeg.  I'm not usually a big butterscotch fan so I was skeptical.  After the first spoonful of butterscotch & cream, I changed my tune.  Rich, sweet, smooth, perfect.  It's a good thing I opted for the cauliflower instead of a meat dish as I never would've finished this otherwise.  Total cost for my two glasses of wine, 4 dishes, tax, and tip came to about $90.  The light bites menu from 3pm-5pm is such that you could get a decent meal and drink for about $20, but Yelp accurately touts FnB as a $$$ type restaurant during the rest of the evening.  I knew that it would be pricey going in, so I have no bones about that.  And honestly it was worth every penny.  Charleen is incredibly creative with her flavor mixes (particularly on her fruit & veggies) & presentation.  Having left full & joyous from a gloriously delicious meal, I can confirm Chef Charleen is indeed worthy not only of being considered the best female chef in the state.  But a strong contender for best chef in the state of AZ, period.

bFS9XINf0CdslyZYbb41OQ.text: Came here for a "Girl's Weekend" in October 2017. We made reservations about a month in advance.  We ordered a bunch of shared plates.  Everything was delicious.  Love the way they rotate the menu and use food that is in season.  Every dish was colorful and flavorful.    The service was fantastic.  Our server gave us some awesome suggestions but really allowed us to order what we thought looked good.  They cleared our dishes quickly after every "round" and made sure our drinks were always full-water and "not water".  The highlight of my night was the butterscotch.  I think I could've asked for one to go in my purse.  It was the BEST butterscotch I've had in 8 years.  If you are in Scottsdale, you need to try FnB.  I know I plan to the next time I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The butterscotch

NIkFH5jtFlkGgwlZUxgIxw.text: Great food, prime location, and an intimate atmosphere. The menu changes seasonally and is very unique. The waiter suggested my date and I order multiple appetizers and entrees and thankfully we didn't because the entrees are large and the appetizers could be a meal for one. This is a very cute restaurant and is perfect for a date night. The food is delicious and fresh. I would definitely go back again.

XrugN5JDlJwoSnfdXrNEyw.text: What a great atmosphere, creative and fun dining experience.  Will be back to this one for sure!

nPLYzwnyFMrR2SWI7nbTcw.text: Took my bf here for dinner for his birthday(his first time)and the staff and chef made it so nice and welcoming.. thank you!! Our meals were local fish and so fresh and we are still raving about it.  He wants to go back next week to see what else they will come up with!!

XrrIWGmc7s_uq0ateW8q_A.text: While visiting Arizona this weekend, our friends said they wanted us to experience this establishment.  They said they had been wanting to try it as it had been recently awarded Restaurant of the Year by some publication.  Unfortunately dinner did not live up to expectations.  We arrived at 6pm for our reservation and were immediately seated in the bar where there were 3 other small tables and about 8-10 at the bar.  The chairs were made out of pop metal, and were incredibly uncomfortable.  I soon  realized that the bartender was not only mixing drinks for the rest of the restaurant, but he was also the server for the tables.  By the time he got to taking our order it was obvious he was overwhelmed.  When I asked him what type of pasta was used in a dish, he replied he didn't know.  Never said "Let me go find out for you" He was much more helpful with the wine selection.  We were finally served our entrees at 730.  Food was OK, but certainly nothing to write home about.  On the way out at 815 I mentioned to the host/manager that the poor bartender was having a hard time.  He said "Oh I'm sending another person over there right now."  I told him it was a little late for that.  In hindsight I should have refused the table in the bar and asked to be seated in the restaurant.

cUsmnGJ-Uwoi_tlRMTg5AQ.text: This place is awesome but make a reservation because it gets packed. I am a pretty decent chef myself, so when i eat out i want to have something that I do not have the skillset to make at home. It could be from certain knife skills, presentation, or the sourcing of food. FnB hit the spot on all three of those categories. Their food was reasonably priced  considering that it is top notch!  When we came we ordered all vegetarian dishes which was great. They have many options for the omnivores. Also if you ask the waiter to make you a vegetarian dish the chef will make you one that will please your palate and eyes.   Can't wait to come again!

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6qxwjJkEnd8p_QitjNxvyQ.text: Love this place. Perfect for a date night, customer service is great and their martinis is delicious!

xH4LgiGF_bRTrm5OBLh34g.text: What a great experience- stumbled across this place last night and they shared that they had a happy hour menu and discount on bottles of Arizona wines.  We had an amazing time and even topped It odd with their butterscotch signature  dessert with a glass of Madeira- we don't even crave butterscotch and It was so unique (omg;)!!suggestions for light bites are house made chips, Dal / radish Salad Board ,& Laura's chicken tamales. Such a nice treat and Rabiah our bar tender / server was so hospitable.  Give this place your attention and time

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

UIMibWCfPf58JvPLtytoAg.text: I can't say anything bad about our meal. Everything was amazing! From the presentation to the taste, incredible! The restaurant can be a bit loud but that is not uncommon for popular hip places. Our waiter made the evening even better. Can't wait to eat here again!

ytP5pGEVCFOFaYmnFpFPYg.text: Great interior setup and best for a candle night dinner. The food has the artistic touch and fresh farm vegetables certainly stands out. We were informed that the menu here changes everyday and the one you see online is a sample.   We tried the kale falafel and it was super melting in the mouth. Rest of the food was above average. Some of the entree have touch of green farm fresh veggies and cooked main base of the entrees.   Key lime cake was great.   Don't forget ask for the in-house bread.  They serve with olive oil but they were better with butter.

lsLiMhyP0ddl3TsHWHt3ow.text: This was a fun experience. We love trying local favorites and the main reason we went to FnB was because of the ratings on yelp. This restaurant recommends that you order 4 dishes per couple. We had the chicken spring rolls and a chorizo appetizer (I forget the name)...both were great; however, I think we preferred the spring rolls. Next we tried the ratatouille which a a great flavor but we didn't expect it to be cold...we thought it would be warm?? Then for our entrees, my husband had the halibut, which he loved and I had the chicken. The chicken was great with a fantastic flavor and it was paired with potatoes and grilled/sauteed peppers. The only thing I wasn't overly thrilled with was how MANY peppers were in the chicken dish...I'm not opposed to the peppers, there was just entirely too many. NOW.....by this point, I really didn't need dessert, especially since i couldn't even finish my dinner; HOWEVER, I wish I would have started with dessert first!!!! I had the toasted cornbread with peaches and mint ice cream!!!! SO AMAZING!!!!! The hubs had lychee sorbet and he loved it. This was a great restaurant....the only reason I gave FnB 4 stars was because I didn't think it was as amazing as all of the reviews. Very good...but I have had better

SMWcJrwONDEb9CRMVcWIuA.text: Although the menus are seasonal (meaning the meals would be different depending on when you're dining here), I knew I wanted to try FnB based on the photos I had seen online.  We ordered the mussels, heirloom cauliflower & grilled broccoli and enjoyed the sunset while seated on their courtyard patio.   They say you eat with your eyes first, and this could not be more True when it came to the food here. Vibrant colours and melange of textures were shown with each dish. You could taste the freshness of all the ingredients used, really driving their farm-to-table image.  I loved the heirloom cauliflowers! The citrus yogurt, buttery pine nuts and basil were perfectly brought together.   We had an amazing and healthy dinner, all thanks to FnB :)

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Winter 2018 menu
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Heirloom cauliflower with  lime labne, pinenuts and basil
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy grilled broccoli with citrus aioli and crispy onions

SyJzSAYnyBKR1WncR3_5WA.text: I just love it when you are exposed to flavors that is not part of the daily norm.  Its just refreshing to taste unique textures that is palatable while pushing the boundaries of exploration. More so, it expands into the curiosity mindset on how basic ingredients can unite together with such harmony on a plate.  Some people in this world just have that special gift that allows them to be artistic and creative on a plate.  I applaud these chefs.   I ordered the grouper fish paired with cauliflower.  Again, the unison of protein and vegetable with the medium of sauce is just sublime.  Definitely recommend the grouper fish dish.  I also enjoyed the mussels.  It wasn't rubbery, which tends to happen when you over cook it.  The taste was light and flavorful.  You can definitely take bread to the sauce and wipe it clean.  The grilled bread with the ricotta cheese is interesting as well.  The seemingly thick but crispy bread was absolutely nice.    I feel that this restaurant found its way on delivering dishes that is mapped out quite well. Taste, texture, and service is well thought out here.  Especially when the server took notice of our sharing and split our entrees.  Love it when people are mindful of such details.    I would recommend anyone to stop by this establishment and enjoy a memorable meal.    **You may want to call in to inquire about its location since its not visible from the streets.**

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Food here is delicious. Love the Grouper fish.

qHhRhww36M9qfprOkZ1viQ.text: Fabulous! Can't wait to return. Very inventive and fresh dishes. Order several to share.

cO9d79SjJgIfUwajb2DYKg.text: Locally sourced ingredients - soup to nuts  Intimate dining environment Focused wine list  Dedicated service

JS2yqrOG3MXoPOFS0PS5AA.text: I don't have enough great things to say about FnB, which make this review that much more challenging. For starters, the incredibly friendly, personable, and attentive owner / host makes you feel like you are eating at his private home instead of a restaurant. He was funny, informative, and always attentive to our questions and needs. Beyond that, their chef is truly an artist with the way she is able to construct complex but perfectly balanced flavor profiles with each and every dish. During our dinning experience we must have ordered at least half of the items on the menu, which were each very distinct and delightful. The wine selection at FnB is vast and perfectly compliments whichever menu items you and your party settle on. Not only is their food outstanding, but knowing that they pride themselves in finding locally sourced ingredients adds another layer to the experience. FnB will provide you with an incredible fine dinning experience, which I advise you to plan ahead and secure a reservation. I can't wait to come back soon and see what amazing new dishes they are cooking up next.   P.S. Happy to be the 500th review. Keep up the outstanding work!
