When we asked the waitress if we could add another small table to accommodate the other dishes we ordered she barked back that she then wouldn't have that one available, despite being there early and the restaurant was less than half full. Very knowledgeable bartender and decent cocktails, but the wine-list was uninspiring..... I get it you want to highlight regions such as Loire and showcase the differences....just have some non esoteric non offbeat wines on the list as well!   The lamb was good, the grains excellent. Polenta was amazing, the curry chicken was "sold" as an authentic Indian flavor explosion....it was undersalted and bland!  At this point I would have still given it 4 stars.... but then the shocker.... the flourless chocolate cake was smothered in whipped cream and totally stale, definitely several days old.... Went straight to Virtu afterwards to have another fantastic dessert!

K40bl2b5-lDU1wxeiv5pTQ.text: Ambient space with an open connected feeling to the plaza outside. Attentive and friendly service. Food was just ok. Broccoli was smothered in aioli. Brussel sprouts were drowning in oil. Black bread with pickled mushrooms and cheese was good. Mussels were also good, though pricey at $17. Not a memorable dining experience, though we wanted it to be.

fZ0qiYWW5xuM31o9kUjQUA.text: Had a great dinner here with friends Wednesday night.   Intimate room, great staff and the food was great. To be honest we had so many killer cocktails I don't remember to many details but I remember that I loved every dish that came out.  If you are looking for a place to take a date or dinner and drinks with the boys this place is legit.

kuqkx50ogVSecRn9Ju01cA.text: Outstanding dinner, best meal I have had in months.  Check out the menu and you'll see why. Corn, feta, arugula peach salad and the best halibut ever and great service, could tell the staff was happy and proud to be working there

8UdOlYsPT_z52CUN3blZTw.text: I've eaten here a number of times over the last four or five years.  Great mix of excellent food and relaxed atmosphere.  I really appreciate the diversity of influences and the liberal use of vegetables and herbs.  That said, do not avoid the proteins - the pate is unctuous in the best sense of the word and any lamb offering on the menu will surely please. Shared plates is the way to go to sample as much as possible and they are generously portioned.  Thumbs up for the AZ forward wine program and the knowledge and passion they bring with all their offerings.  If you want unique, local and excellent in PHX/Scottsdale FnB is not to be missed.

tjcX9JgD6CLIMbvZ2fRIdg.text: After several people recommended this place, we made a reservation for Saturday dinner. We wanted to try a bit of everything so we ordered two small dishes, a vegetable dish, and a main entree to share. To start, there was bread and olive oil that was infused with a bright, perhaps fruity, flavor. The crispy chickpeas were a nice snack. The Peruvian chicken spring rolls were fantastic - very flavorful and with a nicely thin fried wrapper. Perhaps the most interesting dish, flavorwise, was the spicy grilled summer squash with fish sauce. Very savory and innovative. The grilled half chicken was tender and tasty, but the accompanying rice was overly sweet, to the point that we only ate the rice that was less covered in sauce.   Overall, we found all of the dishes to be on the heavier side (maybe just because of our picks) but the flavors were amazing and creative. Service was great. I will definitely return to try some of their other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled half chicken, $30
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spicy grilled summer squash, $11
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Crispy local chickpeas, $6

wlLdBtFTBMvqSDTL9kU1Ug.text: I liked lots of things about FnB: the service, the simple decor, the short seasonal menu, the all-AZ wine list, and especially the food. We tried the terrine, fried squash blossoms, eggplant, and tile fish. I loved the terrine and tile fish. Really liked the squash blossoms. Just liked the eggplant - it was in larger chunks and ended up kinda mushy. However, I still liked the way it was served with some sort of yogurt-y sauce over the top.   Overall, I would award FnB 5 stars.  HOWEVER, I dined (as I often do) with my husband. He is a solid meat-eater. He did not appreciate the focus on vegetables. He did not appreciate the beef-free menu (although at other times, beef may be offered). He wished there were more options overall (only 4 entrees). He did, however, like the wine and the service.   So overall, 4 stars. But don't take a beef-lover there.

RMf87EbndD_VxY5fK0zDIQ.text: I used to come to Phoenix almost weekly for business, so I'm very familiar with the excellent dining scene. I've not made it to FnB till tonight and wasn't disappointed!  Starter: Green Salad - cucumbers l peas l fennel l goat cheese l pistachio. The blend was very good and goat cheese was excellent.   Mid-Course: Fall Corn on the Cob - Calabrian chile l basil l pecorino l pumpkin seeds. This undoubted is the corn either on or off the cob I've ever had! Amazing!  Entree:  Pasta-fresh made in-house l lobster mushrooms l bacon l basil l zucchini l crumbs. Gentle ribbon pasta with a light taste blended perfectly...the bacon was a marvelous touch! Great dish!

kK2FQedk5HkPOTCkVa5Hcg.text: Simply the best in Scottsdale.   Let the waitstaff pick your meal if you are adventurous and you will be amazed.

yvJ3IKO3hPDv_M9dSgS3tg.text: Such an incredible dining experience. From the moment we entered, the owner was welcoming and entertaining. We tried the gizzards and socca to start, with a perfect wine pairing recommendation from Pavle. The ribeye and roasted chicken were cooked to perfection, but presented in such a non-ordinary way with delectable sides and sauces. I'll be back, over and over.

pGNR_asJZxChfjPrgCKndw.text: This place makes me weak in the knees. I love that the menu is always rotating and the portions are always enough to order a few starters and be full with another person, or do two entrees either way! You're good. I usually wind up here and end up eating their leeks with a fried egg..... And day dream about them for the rest of the week.   Their cocktail list is awesome, I will keep coming back and converting people!

4rcXAsUdD2iha-eMQBv0yA.text: Got a huge appetite?  Ready for savory food?  Ok, did you make a reservation?  Yes to all 3 questions?  Well, it is time to head over to the FnB.  WOWzer!  I happened to choose this restaurant by chance on a nite a friend and I were looking for some place different and nw to go to.  I'm so very happy that we did.   this is a small establishment with the kitchen practically the center piece of the small space.  The kitchen is surrounded by the bar.  If you're lucky, you can take a seat there.  BTW, you may make a reservation to be seated at the bar.  I think the restaurant is quaint and has a romantic feel to it.  (This review is based on the old location.  They've since moved.)  That night, I was so happy with the service.  The waitress was kind and thoughtful.  She was very busy.  She was playing hostess as well as waiting on tables.  She explained things on the menu and suggested drinks to us.  I don't recall the mixed cocktails, but we each had 4 different cocktails between the two of us and enjoyed the variety of the flavors in the drinks.  The cocktails were original drinks  We ordered the okra fries, I'm not sure what I was expecting, but they were just "ok" for me.  I was not that impressed by them at all.  However, the dinner was a different story.  I had a wonderful dish with duck in it and my friend had a chicken dish.  Both of the entrees were enjoyed by us both.  The menu changes frequently.  I just visited there 2 months ago and I looked on line to see if I could spefically name the dishes, but the menu is completely different!   I recommend this place for date night!!  It's also nice for out of town guests who enjoy food and think of a meal as a grand experience.

G1oO5Zrj4Wh-mYvfkZEAkA.text: Great food and an awesome experience. The unique combination of local foods, fresh produce  blended with a global flavors was a memorable experience. The cauliflower appetizer was possibly the most flavorful dish of its kind. For my entree, the Lamb was tender, the freshness and crunchiness of the asparagus was complementary to the fava base. Loved the entire meal and my overall experience.

cHAV9NV-jCCKpGLz5ivB4A.text: FnB uses local ingredients and has changing menus. They are located in a small, intimate space off 5th in Scottsdale.   I don't believe it's available on their current menu but I had the duck which was great. My wife ordered the terrine which she absolutely loved.  As an appetizer, there's this cucumber dish that is mouthwatering. I think they still have it on their fall menu. Finally, the dessert was this slice of berry-topped cheesecake which we completely destroyed.  They also have a nice wine selection. If you are in the area, make a reservation here.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. dessert
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. view of kitchen
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Ze Duck!

E6IiZiN31AXbxsbY05KCIQ.text: Absolutely excellent food and service! Have been wanting to come here for 21/2 years and finally came for our anniversary. It was more than we ever expected. Extremely accommodating to my gluten free vegan diet as mostly all plates are organic vegetables focused. Its hard to make vegetables taste like a gourmet meal but they have figured it out using delicious oils and sauces. Can't wait to come back for another special occasion.

_JzM_Xb79jVJcCq2yps2nA.text: Love Love Love this place! The menu is always changing, so you can try new things every time. First time ever eating cauliflower here (over 40 years old), it tasted like candy! Great food, always friendly staff too!

68VJViD0QIk4ZORDTdWXVA.text: One of the best meals I have ever had. Fresh is an understatement. I am a carnivore and was a little disappointed when I first looked at the menu. Vegetables every where with very little meat to be seen.  I ordered the black bass with the accompanying assorted vegetables. We also ordered a few vegetable sides. The fish was amazing!  The vegetables were fantastic!  So much fresh flavor prepared with the upmost care. A very nice wine selection and good assortment of desserts all served by friendly and efficient service personnel. We will be back many more times. Looking forward to experiencing more from their ever changing menu. Do yourself a favor and visit FnB at your earliest opportunity.   Second visit and what a disappointment!  This time, because of the summer heat, we sat inside. It was hot, loud, and cramped.  The food lacked both the wonderful taste and presentation we enjoyed on our first visit. The service was adequate at best. I apologize to all that used my previous review as a basis to visit FnB. Their lack of consistency is cause for us to stay away in the future.

_Q3qIae6EBUugDKPpvn5Yw.text: Lovely gastro pub- went at lunch. Menu too short BUT the green corn soup was to die for! The chicken salad sandwich was also very good. Also service was very friendly. Recommend trying it. Wish I could stay for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Qn7e-L4K6Zy3fpKL51Xaaw.text: Can't say I as very impressed. Tried some of the Arizona wines by the glass and at best, meh. All veggies were fresh but dishes were somewhat unrefined with quantity over quality. Dishes are well intended however, details missing to make it a top notch experience. Ricotta toast soggy in center, Brussel sprouts over cooked. Red wine served at white wine temperatures. Overall, needs a lot of work...

aGZaa6v3C8-luOyojHZ08w.text: FnB is acclaimed locally and beyond, with a super-seasonal menu that has a lot of unique options.  I started with a cocktail: the Cranberry Presbyterian, a ginger ale with cranberry-infused vodka.  I giggled when I saw it listed under the heading "Potent Potables", because Jeopardy.  It was strong and tasty, not quite as cranberry-heavy as I expected, but fresh.  We also had a number of small plates to start, with my favorites being the Peruvian chicken spring rolls and house pulled mozzarella (pictured) as well as the pork rillette.  For my main course, I had the pasta with duck confit, lentils, foraged mushrooms, spigarello, and bread crumbs.  The pasta tasted deliciously fresh, and the combination of flavors didn't taste like anything else I'd had before.  The kudos and recognition this restaurants receives (including two James Beard noms for the best chef in the southwest) don't surprise me a bit!  The service was fantastic and the food was too.  We didn't have the right headcount and they were able to move some tables and accommodate more people quickly, not an easy task in a small restaurant.  Our group was still talking about how great the experience was the next day.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. pasta with duck confit, lentils, foraged mushrooms, spigarello, and bread crumbs
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cranberry Presbyterian, a ginger ale with cranberry-infused vodka
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. house pulled mozzarella

gD-7xJqMwPj5bvS9iHmgqw.text: Just had the most exceptional experience here with my dad.  Each dish was super delicious- and presented like a work of art.  It felt like the flavor/texture/spice/temp balance of each dish had been studied for years in culinary labs around the world.  Whoever is setting the prices is definitely smoking crack - OR has b-list goals in philanthropy as I believe they could easily charge twice as much for each dish.    And the service - perfect in every way.  Our server (Ian, I think, #222 on the check) who looked like a younger cuter Ben Wyatt was super knowledgeable and totally not precious about the large collection of exotic ingredients in the dishes - and very patient in explaining origins and in assisting with French pronunciation!  Bonus!  He had excellent suggestions, fantastic follow up, great casual sharing of fnb vision and purpose without being preachy or pompous.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Farcous with labneh and spring greens.
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Totally European chewey bread wall to wall topped with cultured butter AND soft scrambled duck eggs AND morels.  Stoopid good.
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Roasted carrots with harrissa aiol, avocado and Egyptian nuts chopped up with 1000 spices

1ExE9X-SMvH3lww7mq-cMA.text: Probably one of the best places I've eaten in the PHX area. It is pricey so be ready to wine and dine. It's a treat for sure. Here's what I really liked. The ambience is spot on. Not one bratty kid in site. It's kind of a date type place. It's pretty quaint and quiet. In fact, it feels very French to me. The service is spot on amazing. No complaints there. The have a wine list of death so order away but be ready to pay! My favorite part was learning so much about food just from the menu. I had to look up no less than 10 ingredients on my phone just to know what I was ordering. The menu is not in French. The ingredients were just things I'd never heard of. It was a great dining experience all around!

a1b7Htg0rhula9NLsgDMDw.text: Definitely my best meal in Phoenix, & perhaps even one of the best meals of my life.  Everything is so unique & well thought out, &  HEALTHY but without tasting too healthy, ya know? We really splurged and tried literally almost everything, hehe, but let me share my recommendations.  The bread soup was surprisingly delicious, deep sensuous flavor of green, and the bits of bread were so crispy, a nice contrast. The roasted broccoli was just perfect, perfectly slightly charred and flavorful, simple but oh so good. the heirloom carrots with some sort of harissa sauce - wow and actually, my favorite thing on the menu was the orange salad with pistacchio & tarragon. It was legit the best salad I've ever tasted. The lamb manti-little lamb meatballs - SO tasty, almost crispy on the outside. The falafel was outstanding, perfect little fried balls, that somehow tasted light and refreshing.  ok- soooo i pretty much recommend everything? i guess :) oh, and save room for the chocolate cake. trust me.

xty4Fnhq6AcvNS2cDkQJvw.text: I love this place.  Each eclectic menu item changes periodically and it is little wonder why this place won so many awards.  Each dish is truly a work of art. And they have an extensive alcohol menu too.  Most of my favorites are their beautifully presented and differently named content of their appetizers.  For an incredibly good deal, they are more than  50% off during their early and late happy hours.  This is a great, romantic environment with exquisite food that look like works of art and with ever changing and delightfully surprising menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Trout roulette spread with pickled eggs
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Trout roulette (upper), fried tangy seasoned potato crisps, and grilled chicken

scPZVK1LCCkUwoapkziz2Q.text: Amazing experience here. From the moment you walk in, the staff is smiling and is so friendly. The hostess was great and took initiative to recommend dishes while we decided if we wanted to dine there.   Bill was our bartender and server, and was phenomenal! He was super knowledgeable and you could tell he had a passion for the restaurant, food, and wine. He gave us a memorable experience at FnB and it just topped off our whole Scottsdale experience.   Overall, the food was incredible. The flavor profiles made sense, eat plate had a perfect contrast of textures,  and each dish had a little something unexpected that just made everything POP! The flavor combinations are to die for, and I highly recommend the summer squash salad, porterhouse pork and the cornbread dessert.   We will be back! Keep it up FnB.

8xo_7p_VyCfEaD_Ao5XEjQ.text: 5 stars for service: I am a sucker for good service. It's such a rarity in today's society that you can go anywhere and be treated with respect that finding a place where they do service right is truly a gem. FnB is doing this amazingly well. My first impression even before anything was served to us was so positive based on the kindness and temperament of the staff. Go here to be treated right!  5 stars for food: The menu items were very unique and interesting with flavors that married well. We're in love with changing seasonal menus as it gives us incentive to keep coming back to see what they've got going on, and that's exactly what we're going to do. We had the verde salad, goat cheese stuffed chiles, halibut entree, and pork chop entree on the Summer 2017 menu. Delicious. Delectable. Unique flavors combined that soared.  4 stars for interior: The interior was cute and cozy, but left something to be desired. A lot of the guests were pretty dressed up for their dinners and seemed kind of out of place when sitting inside the restaurant. The interior design seemed to encourage more of a casual vibe rather than upscale, but hey do it up, folks.  Will return to check out the Fall menu and perhaps get a seat outside in the cooler weather :)

MLLY3Jio0dwwBqexJgCNxA.text: What a disappointment.  Came around 1 when they were slow for a monthly catch up with an old friend. Menu had 6 items on it..I understand the chef changes daily (love that concept). Some sounded great to me but my friend just wanted to stick to drinks and bread. Told our server and she seemed annoyed by that.   Our lemon drops were wonderfully made. However it took her 10min to fill our 2nd round when there were maybe 5 other tables in the restaurant. We asked for bread to munch and first plate we got 4 pieces. When we asked for round 2 on drinks AND bread, again we had to wait about 10min for drinks..15 for 3 pieces of bread.  Our waitress had a bad attitude and seemed stoned. It's a cute place that I'm sure could've been a much better experience with the right server. 3 stars for the awesome lemon drop.

VTnhjh_BZEV7SJLajhUnCQ.text: Incredible!   From start to finish-  everything was wonderful!   We had the egg rolls- terrine- asparagus !!!   All dishes have an incredible flavor & texture to them!  The toasted polenta in the asparagus dish is incredible -  explosive flavor!  The eggs rolls- they are a welcomed surprise !  Must try.    Cornbread strawberry dessert... wow!

kjJvJ7wc-VNjPYiQV1bPJQ.text: I wasn't going to peel myself away from the resort but decided to try FnB. What a delight, sat at the bar as people started to surround me creating an intimate atmosphere. I opted for two starters, the orange salad and the asparagus and polenta with fried egg. Oh wow, talk about an explosion of flavors in my mouth. Loved it. Highly recommend, and our bartender was wonderful.

ycEzz_0BOdLijHpYGf0mlg.text: I wanted to love this place. I heard amazing reviews about the food and service, but sadly our experience was terrible. We went early -  6:00 pm on a Saturday night. We knew it was a small restaurant and there really isn't a great table, but could overlook it due to great food and service. It took the waiter more than 10 mins to greet the table and take drink orders. When he came back we tried to ask questions about the menu and place appetizer orders and all he said were the things we were looking at were "salads," and that we needed to place our order all at once, "to give the kitchen a head start." We were so confused - did we order appetizers or not? We should have walked out then. When you are paying close to $40 for a main entree -  this type of service is unacceptable.   Our waiter didn't make any recommendations on the menu and seemed less than interested in our table. After 15 mins he came back and we ordered 2 mains, a salad, and 2 appetizers(for 3 of us). One appetizer came - the Kale Falafel - which was tasty. The other never did. The dinner orders came out over 1/2 hour later. It was obvious we were sharing the mains, but no plate was brought for sharing. The Asian Pear salad I ate was over salted and tasted only of onions. The mains, the pork chop and chicken, were good, but not great. After an hour and half of terrible service in a cramped restaurant, I was done. The waiter was much more interested in drinking wine with another table than providing any service to us. It takes just one person to ruin an experience and he sure did that. I have received better service at Chipolte than FnB.   For the price you will spend on a mediocre meal, there are many, many other Scottsdale restaurants that offer better food and MUCH better service. I am sad to say I won't go back and would only recommend this restaurant if you want to be ignored.

FnXdzLpYouZtA_4OpxXPZQ.text: A business school professor often spoke about "running the room." Pavle, as yelpers commented, runs the room. Of subtle wit, he is entertaining and informative at the same time.  After a small stumble with a server about where I could sit, I chose the outdoor patio. (This review is for a visit in February.) It was pleasant to sit outdoors after escaping San Francisco's cold rain for Giants Spring Training in Scottsdale. Go Giants!  A  friend advised me to visit FnB due to my being a vegetarian, and FnB delivered. I wanted to order everything on the menu that was vegetarian, and asked Pavle to decide for me.   After good bread served with fruity olive oil, I ate Tuscan Kale Falafel with a tzatziki style spicy sauce. Who needs kale salad after this delicious appetizer?   Next was a beautiful, refreshing salad, with just-picked tasting ingredients. Salad as art. I loved the green apples in combination with cucumbers.   Meat eaters could be happy with the vegetables as entrees. Pavle chose butternut squash, whose sweetness was highlighted by the miso butter and almonds. Flash-fried cauliflower with lemon-caper yogurt and purple sumac were equally good. The Chef creates innovative flavor combinations. The portions are large, so I took food home for the next day's lunch. Tip: try the famous butterscotch pudding. I will next time.   The lady food runner was very pleasant. Don't forget to check out their cute store of local products. Great experience and great food!

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Flash fried cauliflower, preserved lemon-caper yogurt, purple sumac
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Butternut squash with miso butter, almonds, crispy onions
Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green salad: asparagus, snap peas, cucumber, green apple, goat cheese

XHyOvSveSZUY4IOiU5nTZQ.text: My fiance and I came here for our first anniversary last night and they made us feel cherished.   We  had requested a vegan meal via OpenTable and the chef prepared six off menu vegan dishes split to two plates.  I had casually checked the box in OpenTable to tell them that it was our anniversary and the owner came out and greeted us with sparkling wine, congratulations, and a special meal recommendation.  We never had to peruse the menu and we had an amazing experience.  He joked that FnB is the best vegan restaurant but he wasn't kidding.  The dishes were as good as any we've had at Michelin star rated places.

M01Ct4dW6_i6Z1oDIq5eAw.text: Dinner tonight.   Started with a good bottle of wine at a reasonable price. Had to go to France for a decent Chardonnay. Too bad with so many good California choices.   Had two app's:  Spring rolls were outstanding. Great preparation and presentation. Right degree of flavor and spice. The Amarillo mayo was delicious. A+ Pickled shrimp app was ordinary. Fresh vegetable lacked something, maybe jalapenos. Ehh. C+ Both of us had the goulash. Very good but lacking the expected paprika undertones. Lots of beef potatoes and onion. No spice no cabbage. More Irish stew than the Nectar of Hungary. Solid B+ Dessert was a mess. Ice cream pecan something or other on a piece of puff pastry that resembled shoe leather. Disaster F Service was good. Prompt courteous and light hearted. Nice guy but should have steered us away from a few bad menu choices. B+

LV2DDZy9co5FPzMyfDnc6Q.text: Our very first time here tonight and my husband and I have a new favorite in the neighborhood. We loved the different flavors in the unique dishes and our drinks were refreshing and delightful. Service was on point as well! Delicious and interesting menu with an array of veggies and just good wholesome comfort food. A wonderful experience overall.

5MFDNqzRP42XfDOqJaFzXA.text: Incredible. One of the best dinners I have ever had.   Great service and atmosphere.   Everything on the menu is delicious.   This is a MUST try place.

photos.caption: Photo of FnB - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pasta with fresh vegetables

yEKQVvOqKm1QpLfheewfYw.text: Absolutely brilliant food. Great front of the house guy, very quaint location and design. Great, very imaginative wine list.Only bad thing is, I miss the bodega

iYWzUkWzxozWxLNKI6XlaQ.text: FnB's always thinks of creative foods and flavors to combine, creating a effect where all the ingredients are perfectly in balance, with flavors that never cancel each other out. Their salads are always sufficiently dressed but are never drenched, if that's even possible.  Their service is spotty sometimes which I unfortunately got the worst of during my last visit. I had a waiter who took three minutes to seat me, despite being visible from waiters station and kitchen.   Even then I wasn't a priority. I was seated at two-person table in a corner of the restaurant, which was still visible to everyone who passed by. I do not ask much but to have my drink refilled at a decent rate which it wasn't.   I had an appetizer which was taken away fairly quickly after I was done, but I don't think it was by my regular waiter. Then finally when I was done with my main meal, I waited at least 15 minutes to have my plate taken and get my check.   The wait staff and my waiter were clearing a table across the room but still didn't notice me across the way, despite having pushed my plate away and tinkering on my phone, which is the nonverbal way of communicating, "I am ready for my check now."  I wouldn't have gotten my check if I hadn't flagged my waiter down.   I'm always appreciative of the quality in food I order at FnB, but I won't be back for awhile for the way I got neglected during my last visit.

TZVJGa0zqcj8BVvmweiZfA.text: Outstanding service, great food with interesting flavors- plenty of options for vegetarians.  Desert was lacking, caramel sauce was burned on the pecan tart.

xBPXUmE884IH9n9uH93vLQ.text: FnB is by far the best restaurant for a great dining experience.  The food is delicious and eclectic and its a treat to have tomatoes taste really like tomatoes.  FnB  is a party for your taste buds.  The menu changes often and has the best of what seasons have to offer. Getting a bite for lunch there on the weekend is one of the things that i do enjoy.

8B7a3aVKDf90jgHrM7OmKQ.text: The reviews are True: FnB serves top-notch fare to nourish your body and soul. Can you say leek gratin? It's pronounced "goo-eee dee-lish-ish-ness". As in 'heaven'. As in, did I mention it was topped with a perfectly poached (local, organic) egg?  The space is itty bitty, but the ambiance is intimate and effortlessly charming (kind of un-Scottsdale, do I dare say?). Do yourself a favor: make a reservation. They were totally booked when I visited around 8 pm on a Wednesday night.  With a focus on AZ wines and locally sourced ingredients, this would be a great spot to bring out-of-town guests or potential in-laws you'd like to impress with your sustainable eating habits and sophisticated palate. Just make sure that if the in-law thing doesn't work out, then you get dibs on this place after the break-up. It's really too small to run into an ex without things getting awkward.  Speaking of awkward, our server described in a detailed and faintly condescending lecture EVERY SINGLE ITEM ON THE MENU. It felt like an episode of Portlandia. I did not ask if he knew the chicken's name or how it got along with the other chickens, but it took all of my willpower. All of it. Which means I had no willpower left to resist eating more than my fair share of leek heaven. Or dessert. Pronounced "yum yum yum".  I do love the locavore concept and the thoughtfulness behind the food. And I plan to return, even if a lengthy lecture is part of the menu.

yyUQtN1NTKe0pezj6wrU2Q.text: You must eat here! It's as simple as that. Still not convinced?! Read on...  We are out of towners visiting the area on holiday and a friend recommended this place, although they hadn't been here, but had heard great things.  To start with, my wife ordered the pate and I the fried green tomatoes. Both were delicious options. My FGTs were tangy, zesty and extremely fresh in a light batter. The secret sauce was superb and complimented the tomatoes. The pate was plentiful, meaty and juicy: just how it should be.   For our entree, my wife ordered the chicken and I went for the short ribs. We shared a side of brussels sprouts cooked in a fish sauce, rather than the curried. WOW. Order these and do not be put off by fish sauce.  The chicken was tasty, with the right amount of garlic. HOWEVER, my short ribs were out if this world. Incredible flavour, succulent, beefy, clean and probably the most amazing short ribs I've ever had. I'm not exaggerating.   You will not be disappointed if you choose to eat at FnB. I will return.

UDm_PjWcLciMT8O8WeTkVg.text: Probably one of the top notch spots to dine if you know your food. Fresh is an understatement. Menu is in constant change which again, if you know your food and gastropubs well, you will know that just like the Four Seasons; everything must be changed to fit the harvest of the present. Their pickling of vegetables is an art. A little pretentious some might say. I couldn't disagree more. This food belongs at a larger establishment to hopefully reach the minds and palettes of other foodies.

9Xv3EixmXqpz2Nq2bSoCfA.text: I chose this place for it's really cool ambiance and the way it's tucked away behind everything.  It was nice that it wasn't so loud and right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. The patio is GREAT and the inside has a very intimate and mellow vibe to it so it's beautiful for a date.   I like to consider myself fairly adventurous when it comes to food, but the menu threw us off guard and nothing looked very appealing. We decided to have a glass of wine and moved on to Cien Agave for dinner. It seems like everyone else like it. Perhaps I'll go back with a better idea on what to expect and a more open mind!

mAiCyFKqP-wrph4lsKzBZA.text: Amazing gem of a restaurant. Went with 3 others while on a business trip. Everything from the appetizers to the main dishes were exceptional. A True farm to table, the ingredients felt as if they had been just picked / foraged and then expertly prepared in a way that was creative yet not overly so that the taste of the ingredients were lost. From the composition to the texture to the taste, every dish hit the right note. I'm glad there were four of us so we could order a bunch of appetizers and try everything in addition to our mains. Portion sizes were perfect, when the appetizers came we were all surprised by how shareable they were (maybe we're just used to small new york city apps). Overall, I loved everything about this restaurant, I am actually hoping work brings me back to Arizona again just so I can eat there.

x0NHo0g9cINQH6vKDrXo5A.text: Food was great, very accomodating. Can't wait to go back.

ImbrtK2Q5hfysO6PwWQD6Q.text: One of the best restaurant experiences I've ever had. The owner is amazingly nice, hands on, and has such a welcoming personality. He knew that we had never been to his restaurant before and went out of his way to make us feel welcome and fully informed on the interesting menu. We smiled ear to ear for the entire meal. The food was excellent, prepared expertly and clearly with love. The wine list is handpicked and packed with gems. The owners and employees love what they are doing and you can tell in every aspect of this place. Get a reservation and get to this place today, it's a top notch experience that you won't forget.

8ge2zK75QjonCbBk60NUWQ.text: I'd been wanting to go to FnB for the longest time and based on reviews and word of mouth I was excited. I knew that meals could be pricey, but I didn't mind based on how good the food was supposed to be.  My friends and I had a reservation so there was no issue with having to wait once we arrived and that was awesome.  When I got there I was promptly greeted. The staff was very friendly and didn't have the attitude that people accuse servers at Scottsdale restaurants to have.  We took a little time to decide what we wanted to drink and the staff was fine with us taking time to make a decision. When we did order our wine was served within a reasonable time...except for my glass. And once everyone else's drinks were delivered the server seemed to disappear. It probably took about 15 minutes for a server to come back so I could ask for my wine that never got served. I got my wine shortly after asking for it, but no apology for the error, which I didn't care for. Felt a bit like an "oh well" situation.  When it was time to order, I had wanted the salmon but was informed they were out. I could somewhat understand this though as we had a later reservation (8 pm). I decided to order the pasta with sausage instead. The dish had good flavor (great seasoning and not too salty) and was a good portion size. The herbs in the dish were fresh and flavorful. Was it an entree worth the $19 price tag...not in my opinion.  Now that I've been, I can say I've been, but don't have to go back.

jSpIQbBuHoa9gj-o4V6DIg.text: Love love love this place! It is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix. Charleen amazes me every time I eat there. She is so talented. The service is always great, Pavle and Chantelle are amazing!

vMaDp4v1DqmU3clkUKLiJQ.text: I was stoked to find a highly rated Farm to Table restaurant to enjoy during our brief stay in the area, and even chose lodging to be within walking distance of FnB.  I apparently have a very different ideal, based on quite enjoyable meals at the Nest in Portland, Art of the Table in Seattle, the Chicken and the Egg in Atlanta, Allim in Great Barrington, which I've reviewed as well as number of other dining establishments all the way to the iconic Chez Panisse  in Berkeley.  I'm a Farmer's Market, Farm to Table cook who prefers chickens from my local small farmer butchered the previous day and greens picked from my garden in time for dinner, tomatoes that haven't had the flavor dulled by refrigeration.  A previous reviewer described FnB as follows:  This would be an ideal place if you: 1) Care about what goes in your body; health conscious yet still a big foodie 2) Love vegetables 3) And desserts (how can you not?) 4) Prefer an Intimate, quiet ambiance 5) Look forward to Farm to Table, beautifully concocted and creative dishes   To this I would say: 1) I care about what I eat and enjoy good ingredients well prepared. 2) I  rate restaurants on how well they prepare vegetables more than what they do with the protein entree.   I was a vegetable breeder and know how good they can be when bred for eating rather than long haul transportation and processing. 3) Desserts?  It seems rather counter to caring about what goes in your body to dump sugar into it, but heh, if it floats your boat, why ever not? 4) I greatly prefer an intimate quiet ambiance, not the loud cacophony of high ceilings with nothing to break up the sound and the room crowded with people trying to be heard.  We couldn't hear each other, let alone the wait staff.  5) The dishes were indeed creative, and beautifully concocted.  The food quality going into the dishes was less than expected, vegetables included.  The steak was nothing like our usual grass finished dry aged  beef and the chicken was tough and lacked the distinct chicken flavor of our local pastured fryers.  I'm not sure where the Farms are that FnB sources  for their Table.  I certainly haven't seen any driving into the Phoenix area. Perhaps they are doing the best they can with what they can source in the desert.  The lager was sweet and the by the glass wine selection is  limited to AZ and NM wines, which I find too sweet to drink.  I can understand that they are catering to local tastes, but FnB does not compare favorably with Farm to Table restaurants elsewhere.

A9rfUo2UhlpjWu9TXbxH2g.text: Good was excellent but service was super slow.  It seemed they had one waitress for the whole place. Place is very small and cramped.

iid2AoQ1Hg2ed9ZnrSD9oQ.text: Fabulous fresh food, friendly and knowledgeable service(Ian) and a great setting make this a standout restaurant.  Can't believe I waited so long to try it.  Ian was very patient with us because we had so many questions.  One of the owners was there greeting and seating and was very personable.  The chef was out of town but whoever was in her place was great! Would definitely go back. We tried a variety of food on the menu and didn't hit one bad item. Menu changes daily.  Will go back for sure!

xTHr6FtkYujn1Abtdi70lg.text: What a great oasis of gastro-sophistication in the middle of Old Town (otherwise loaded with pretty cheesy restos)! This family-run place is bustling w/ foodies, and pulls off consistently great meals using fresh, local ingredients + service w/ pride & love. As a solo diner, I didn't think I'd need reservations...and I was almost wrong! 7pm on a mere weeknight & there was only 1 seat at the chef's bar left.   Service = 5 stars.  Immediate, efficient, so warm & welcoming. The back-of-the-house is actually right there in the open. Sit at the chef's bar & the ladies will talk up a storm w/ you. Incredibly attentive on refills of water, wine, delivery of food, whatever your need - super pro!   Wine = 4 stars.  Since the focus is on AZ/local fare, you can imagine it's an extremely well-edited (focus on edited) list. A+ they offer a 375ml Gruet blanc de noirs for just $15. Best deal on the list!   Food = 4 stars.  Ordered a handful of small plates instead of an entree so I could try more things. Rock shrimp was tender & just cooked right, grilled broccoli was very tasty (albeit a bit cold), braised leeks & mozz also tasty but very rich.   The biggest a-ha was that the amazing olive oil they use - I guarantee you'll love it - is $4/btl from Trader Joe's! The staff will be thrilled to tell you all about it, too, so be sure to ask.   Will definitely go back, as the menu changes seasonally. So wonderful to have a food option in Scottsdale other than the dime-a-dzn Coyote Ugly-type bars & poser sushi joints.

8vYKyQ1Q47fqQo6sxqOLPw.text: in phoenix for a couple of days. friend recommended we eat here. we had been traveling for a couple of weeks, pretty foodie group, several great high end meals.  this place blew us all away. hands down the meal of the tour.  we ate family style so food just kept coming, salads, vegetable dishes, fish, meat and pasta. there is a definite style to the cooking, it takes south american and mexican elements, north african and middle eastern flavors and european and american techniques and turns it into something distinctive and beautiful.  the feel of the place is more pop up or friends home than fancy restaurant. the food has a very appealing homemade rather than overtly commercial or refined feel to it. really good arizona wines featured, locavore produce and meat, ridiculous desserts, really all remarkable. don't miss it.

zrbZPg177hfaB_rvZWShcA.text: The menu is super creative, bordering bizarre, but without trying too hard. We enjoyed everything, from the local NM and AZ wine by the glass, to the beets, roasted squash and chicken. The decor is welcoming and romantic. Highly recommend a reservation.

V2-idu4qqZRzwW4nXQhHHg.text: I'm updating to five well-deserved stars.   The jidori chicken is so good, it even has me eating meat off the bone (I'm a boneless girl... no wings or ribs for me under ordinary circumstances. But, for this chicken I am compelled to make an exception)!!   The pasta is perfectly salted and cooked. Hearty, fresh and delicious.   I'm certain you cannot have a bad meal here.   One of my favorite Valley restaurants!!

IqLWMRcyGOsCTdNvZmOaiA.text: We enjoyed 4 of the six dishes we ordered. The two disappointments were the pear salad and the duck. The socca was wonderful and the okra was unique and had a very layered flavor. The service was friendly but we had dishes we didn't order placed in front of us twice. We ended up reading our phones and local magazines between courses as there was some wait time. Enthusiastic attempt but needs a little more effort at reigning in the number of ingredients.

2IMeCCE_2P-ZQiVNxsVJqg.text: Very friendly staff, great atmosphere, drink options weren't great, but food was very good

v0oJlU4HkoFR9SofsxKqUA.text: This place is way too small for any party over 6.  We came in as a party of 8 and we had to sit shoulder to shoulder for dinner.  It's hard hard to enjoy dinner when I can't even get out of my seat without bothering my neighbors.  The food was nothing special compared to other local steak houses.  The service was good.  It could be romantic for a couple with modern European decor.    This place is great for couples, not suitable for groups.

lKZBE3K9eQVgkYsWLJnHrw.text: 5 Stars? Really people, are you that shallow? I will return to any Fox restaurant any day of the week before I ever step foot at this pretentious spot. At first I couldn't tell if the waiter Pavle was charming-then I realized he was a pompous, condescending a-hole. The food was ok, not great, not awful. Never again.

9QrC9sCQi2ec5vWkILs4kQ.text: I ate at FnB while visiting Scottsdale, largely based on the rave reviews of my fellow Yelpers.   Loved the amazingly edited, flavorful, really interesting menu, which I'm sure changes really often. This so could have been 5 stars EXCEPT other than getting our order and rushing us out with the check, our service was pretty... Absent. Although shout out to the water boys who kept us hydrated.   My other beef is about the "B" in the name. In my mind, there would be some expectation of real drink options based on the name alone. I'm usually a fan of BYO, but I thought the corkage fees (even for beer?) were inordinate and not keeping with the spirit of the place.

MJ0c3GqCQ9WCAbhae4lFPw.text: I could rave on and on about fnb, but that'd just be repetitive given what everyone else here has said. So instead, I'd rather just give you my   TOP 5 TIPS for a LEGENDARY FNB EXPERIENCE  1. Call ahead. Atleast a week, because the days of popping in are long gone. My impression is that if you're willing to take the old people slots (REALLY early, like 5pm) or the raver slots (the latest seating), you're good to go. But that sweet spot 7pm seating? You can't call early enough.   2. Relinquish control of your drink choices. FnB has one of the most talented mixologists in town- his cocktails are made of unicorn dust and leprachan DNA.  Relay your tastes and something magical will appear before you, whether its a cocktail or wine perfectly suited to you.   3. Don't overthink the menu. Its divided into four "parts" which loosely translate to "starters, more starters, possible side dishes but could also be starters, and entrees". Don't try to outsmart the menu, like some guests of mine have, just pick a few starters, an entree and a few sides for the table. There is literally nothing on menu that could be bad, so share everything.   4. FnB vegetables contain opiates.  This is not scientific, but purely observational, because FnB has over the past year made me love fava beans, spaghetti squash, and rutabagas, none of which I have ever been gaga over. They just do something great to veggies, and at some point i'll learn to order nothing else while there. Dear Pavle & Charleen, I hate brussel sprouts. If anyone could change that opinion, it'd be you.   5. If there are leeks on the menu, order them. Do not pass go, do not collect 200$, just go directly to leeks. This seasonal dish is legendary- an odd mix of mozzarella, braised leeks, breadcrumbs and an egg. Its heaven.   The unwritten rule is this: introduce yourself. To Pavle, to Charleen, to Colleen, to Emily, to everyone on staff. They are the friendliest, warmest, most wonderful people, and good friends to have.

VNbmW906fjl-_7YzsOyXog.text: Still my favorite restaurant in Phoenix area, hands down, no question.  Charleen Badman is just amazing and can make any vegetable just delicious, and make it look easy!  I love that their menu is changing with what's seasonally available, it's always fun to try the new items.  We enjoy going here SO much and try to go at least once a month if not weekly!!  Love love love FnB!!!

ztmHpWR0IBa_LRbISY9sAA.text: FnB is amazingly executed and has an interesting seasonal menu. Really fantastic food for the Scottsdale area. Try everything and go back often!

78st9QHtnMQmB-2DNUT3Gg.text: Excellent dessert.  If you go here you must try the desert.  We shared the  butterscotch pudding which is the best pudding I  have ever had.  I was trying to steer clear of sweets, but with the recommendation of you must have this...I went for it.  I am glad I did since the desert at FnB can be put in my most memorable deserts of all time. Yes when I am dieting I can dream of FnB.   I also enjoyed the fingerling potatoes with the dirty chicken gravy and a super fresh sandwich.  I am not a fan of basic sandwiches, but with recommendation by FnB staff I went for it.  The mix of hummus, turkey, avocado, even feta cheese made a great dish.  I even liked the pickled corn and peppers.  Can't say I ever had pickled corn on the cob before, so it was another exciting moment for me:) What a great lunch, so great that I can't wait to come back and enjoy some dinner dishes.  You should try them out as well, what a great place.

2msuXBqJMldEe09wVPACtw.text: Pretty good food. Service was very knowledgeable and accommodating.  The open kitchen is awesome and over all it was a great experience. We felt the appetizers recommended to us were flat and needed additional salt and acid.  Some of the best broccoli I've ever eaten. Enough said.

1wZ6MGrgcu3rKnEN58gLUQ.text: Average food, even worse service. I am amazed that this was the same restaurant that had such glowing reviews. Would not recommend to anyone.

hxDZ4sOL2NzNabFoJHghaA.text: Absolutely superb.   My boyfriend made reservations about a week ago for my birthday dinner last night at FnB. They called him earlier in the day yesterday (Friday) to confirm, which I absolutely love.   We arrived 15 minutes early but were seated immediately by Pavle. He pulled out my chair for me, called me all different terms of endearment, was incredibly attentive, etc etc.   When my boyfriend asked if they had lemonade, Pavle said "no, but I have simple syrup and lime juice in the back. How about a limeade?" It seems silly, but that was such a great touch. Also, the limeade was awesome!  We ordered the moz/leeks/egg dish and oh, wow. The leeks were cooked perfectly, the bread crumbs added the perfect crunch, and the egg mixed with the delicious, warm, gooey mozzarella was the perfect mixture of tastes and texture. Wow.   We also ordered the grilled spicy broccoli with pistachios. Perfect amount of spiciness - not so bland that you're questioning where the heat went, but not so spicy to where your mouth is on fire for minutes afterward. The broccoli was thick and cooked perfectly - grilled and still crisp.   Both my boyfriend and I are vegetarians and were told that we could order a specially made plate. Because we were so full from the two appetizers, we split a vegetarian entree.  And again ... wow. We were given a plate overflowing with food. It was a trio of dishes - broccoli with (we think) cumin rice and a tomato garnish/sauce, potatoes with pea pods and (I believe...) spinach, and beans with spinach, and an array of green leafies. Each bite was more delicious than the one prior. We hardly talked as we devoured the food. So good, so tasty - everything was seasoned perfectly and perfectly cooked.   I was so excited to have a vegetarian dish that wasn't just pasta with a vegetable thrown in. It is so nice to have an innovative vegetarian dish that truly felt like it was made creatively. Pavle told us he truly appreciated the assessment of the vegetarian food, and we let him know how absolutely wonderful it was.  He also let us know they have a vegetarian tasting menu once every few months, which trust me, we'll be going to.   Overall, one of the best dining experiences I've had in a very long time. We truly felt like we weren't burdening the (amazing) staff with any requests or questions. They were all so friendly and attentive.   We will definitely be back to FnB.

S4CCRovJILqg7UZclTn9nA.text: From the extremely nice hostess and waiter, who I imagine are owners as well, to the great ambiance and even better food I can't he'll but give this restaurant a 5! Definitely recommend!

TSRu2kZaRs_tNGk9Oe2sQQ.text: Great experience at this restaurant. You have to be open to new dishes and willing to try different flavors of foods. The menu was interesting and simple. I wish they had more items on their menu though. This place is definitely not good for kids because they probably would not enjoy the food. It is very pricey here so you would not want a big party - main courses are 25-28$. I would go back pretty often but only on special occasions realistically. Couldn't afford these prices haha. Overall it was an unexpectedly good experience to try unique combinations of foods.

Fg8IhnPsvU1A59ij6isIHw.text: One of my favorite books  is Michael Pollan's "Omnivore's Dilemma".  Pollan explains how humans have the rare luxury of being able to determine what to eat from a virtually limitless supply of options. Not only can we choose what foods to consume (meats, grains, veggies, dairy, etc...)  we can narrow down that decision to cuisines, preparation styles (raw, steamed, grilled, etc..), the food's source (local, industrial, pastoral) and if the food was scientifically altered somehow (molecular gastronomy, genetic engineering, hydrogenation, etc..)  Choices, choices, choices!  While I love food, sometimes I just don't want to think about it anymore. I want to let the professionals take over. The good people over at FnB are the pro's I have been looking for. I had dinner there last Saturday night. I could break it all down for you and describe each dish, but I want this review to focus on the general concept of placing your trust in a restauranteur. While I have only been once, I now trust that FnB will serve fresh, local produce. I trust that the menu is simple and seasonal. I trust that I am not a mere piggy bank funding their next concept restaurant. I trust that the chef will produce really good food without cutting corners by adding excess amounts of salt, butter, cream or sugar (don't insult my palate's intelligence). And I trust that members of the kitchen staff get paid more than the decorators or "ambiance engineers".  I trust FnB to follow through for me so I have no regrets.  I'm definitely going back soon. In fact, what the hell.... I'm going back next weekend. Hope to see you there.

kpvahV9RcjPf9d2uiH9M0g.text: Hands down, FnB is my favorite restaurant in Arizona. This small gem in Old-Town Scottsdale is a unique, classy place with food and service that are nothing short of stellar. Sitting down at the high top bar that encompasses the cooking suite is my favorite place to dine. Being able to engage with chef Charleen Badman and the kitchen staff as they prepare your food is a key element in the dining experience. However, the unforgettable experience begins as soon as you walk in the door. Pavle Milic runs the front of the house and is the most sincere and charming man you will ever meet. His passion for serving and fussing all over patrons gives FnB a unique charm. The interior makes you feel like you're in a street-side cafe in New York.  I've been here many times and decided it was finally time to write a review. I remember last year I brought my mom in on Mother's Day and we tried the Braised Leeks with the Fried Egg ($13). We wanted to try a dish that was different than something else we would normally order, and this hit the spot. No wonder it was listed as one of the 10 Best Restaurant Dishes of 2010 by Food & Wine. This was an amazing dish, and something only Charleen could come up with. I love her dynamic approach to taking the "ugly" vegetables and turning them into delicious food.   Pavle features an exclusive Arizona wine list, and rightly so. Arizona wines have much to offer and Pavle is a strong supporter of Arizona wines. I am a huge fan of Sam Pillsbury's wines, and always happy to have a glass of the Diva or Roan Red ($13) at  FnB. Pavle also does cocktails right. The Sundowner - Aperol and bubbly ($9) is done perfectly, reminding me of my trip to Italy. For a special after-dinner drink, the Chartreuse VEP ($16) is an exquisite beverage and worth the splurge.   Pavle, his wife Emily, Charleen and the whole staff are one of the main reasons I go back. Their friendship that was built through this little restaurant is very valuable. The food is innovative and takes simple food and does it in ways that you wouldn't have thought.   One final note, working in the foodservice industry, I absolutely love the late night food that is available on Saturday nights from 10-midnight. The vibe changes and it's a hangout where you can grab a great dish (chilaquiles!) and a cold local beer.

mKJAQ1b_4hThpArEYajHEw.text: Maybe my expectations are getting high...but why not?   We went to FnB last night and the menu lacked great choices.  The whole menu except for the last 4 items and one item on the top was all vegetarian.    We started with the cheese plate and it was a small slice of blue bree,nuts and burnt piece of nut bread that we witnessed being scraped off after it was burned and a blob of yucky apricot goo...wouldn't the dish washer tell them no one was eating it?  Next we had a braised leeks with mozzarella with a fried egg on it...it would be fine as a side... but not an app?  Next came the pasta...it was ok, not house made it had a heavy sauce and a lot of chewy mushrooms,squash cubes and wilted bacon...nothing special.  Dessert was a steamed chocolate cake that was dry as a bone served with a table spoon size scoop of banana ice cream...the coffee was pretty good.  The tap water was even bad so we ordered bottled...  I fear that the owners are cutting corners and making things that are easy to make with the small quarters they have.  We have been many times before and the menu has been more inspired and so has the food.  I hope they are not getting burned out...

tmbmPhjKGc_tJgxTObAW0Q.text: I do not understand less than four stars. We had six different plates. Beet Salad, Rabit, Butter,Scallops,Strawberry desert, and Peach desert.  All were brilliant. Our favorite (both agreed) was the Beet Salad. It was so fresh and had a perfect combo of flavors and textures.   Service was way more than perfect. One note they are now BYOB with a corkage fee for Beer and Wine. No fee if the Beer or Wine is from Arizona.  One note for FnB we were preplexed with the lack of pork on the menu :-)

lzQNTNHpCIusTe4KxtTl9g.text: Went for a girl's night, we shared various courses based on the server's recommendations.  Tried one of the wines from Cochise County - described as similar to a super Tuscan - good stuff.  They do have a "backup" list of wines, in case AZ vineyards are not your thing.

pxr-q5zr-7PAnxy81jVrDg.text: The lamb short ribs- WOW!!!! We are sad they are only a special - we considered getting some to go. One of the best plates I've had in a while. This place continues to awe us. We love getting a handful of dishes and sharing them. FnB transforms vegetables into amazing things! And you must try the butterscotch pudding for dessert- another WOW!!! FnB is one of the best places to eat in scottsdale!

9FPsZsLVUMoiE2ZtW84iYw.text: Always great food made w/ locally sourced ingredients. Very hospitable owners & staff. Menu is always changing making you want to come back for more. Intense wine program.

nbAJFWTsGXbC8yoKpxSkFA.text: Spanish food with a new world spin. Tortilla (omelet) with purple potatoes served with mild chorizo was served on a wood platter. Black bean dip came with plantain and corn chips - gluten free! BBQ beef rib lunch portion was a pleasant surprise. Attentive prompt service.

oh2nduH1A-QyHehMOjwCVQ.text: Go. To. FnB.  I just recently had my anniversary dinner at FnB with my girlfriend and it was truly a phenomenal experience. Char, Pavle and Emily deserve every pleasant thing that I've heard about them, and they certainly deserve every single star in this review. I felt like a "guest" (I want to stress guest because I didn't just feel like a customer) the whole time I was in the restaurant. Oh, and I noticed the same treatment to the rest of the guests in the restaurant as well; Pavle knows what he's doing.  Oh, yeah! Food!   We tried a lot of different items on the menu by splitting everything, and I couldn't have been happier. We had the eggplant with pomegranate, za'atar and yogurt, a cauliflower dish that was substituted for the okra dish, the braised leeks and the pasta with creme fraiche, bacon and butternut. Every single dish  was very well crafted with multiple layers of flavor and texture, but they were very simple when it came to ingredients. I would really like to say that there was one thing that I would call favorite, but I can't. If the cauliflower stays on the Fall 2010 menu, it's worth a try. The eggplant was dreamy to me because I love za'atar. Za'atar is a simple Middle Eastern spice blend that adds a great flavor to most things it is put on, and it brought the eggplant dish together. The braised leeks? Well, I now understand why critics are crazy about them... Fantastic mozzarella, mustard bread crumbs and leeks covered with a gooey eggs? Count me in anytime. Lastly, the pasta. Bacon is really a wonderful thing to see when looking at the description of a pasta dish  that already had butternut and creme fraiche. It didn't disappoint; scrumptious until the last bite.  Oh my... I've gone on and on. I couldn't help it though, FnB was and is a place with hype that does not falter when faced with customers ready to be blown away. It was worth every penny and I can't wait to head back down to Old Town the next time I want to have a great meal at a classy (and cozy) eatery.  PS: My girlfriend and I also had the butterscotch pudding for dessert. Wow, just wow...
